data.formatted_address: Phường 4, Dalat, Lam Dong 66000, Vietnam
data.name: Đường Hầm Điêu Khắc

reviews.text: Visited this park during the week. Not so far from Dalat, not so crowded before midday. Great place surrounded by pines to walk and take photos. Interesting location with lots of sculptures and figures, very creative.

I took a trip to the Clay Tunnel by motorbike, and it was an adventure worth every minute. The roads leading up to this spot were pretty decent, so you don't have to worry about a bumpy ride. Along the way, there are a few cool places you can check out too. It's like a mini-tour. And when you do get to the Clay Tunnel, it's like stepping into another world. The sculptures there? Absolutely amazing. They've got this vibe that just makes you go "wow." Now, here's a heads-up – there's not much shade around, so slap on some sunblock before you head out, especially if you're planning to visit during the sunny hours. Trust me, you'll thank me later. And try to hit the road early. Not only do you get to enjoy the quiet of the morning, but you also dodge the crowds. That means you can get those Insta-worthy shots without having to elbow your way through a bunch of photo-hungry tourists.

This place is gorgeous especially for IG-able photos. We took a grab from Da Lat city centre to the clay tunnel for slightly less than 150.000dong and it took about 20 minutes. The place doesn’t accept card payments so make sure to bring enough cash (120.000dong per adult). The sun can be strong and you wouldn’t notice it because of the cool weather so please apply sunscreen.

Beautiful art installations, there are many great spots for photography. I believe it can get crowded during weekend. But it's a must visit place in Da Lat. We paid 120 000 per person, but it was worth it.

I really enjoyed my visit here, the quality of the workmanship that has gone into these creations is brilliant and I highly recommend a visit.

The only criticism that I have, and this is by no way aimed at the venue operators, is the sheer number of inconsiderate people who fail to wait their turn or just walk in front, apparently completely oblivious to the fact that you are trying to take a picture.  Show a little situational awareness and respect people!

I did find it particularly difficult to take a picture with the two heads with the lake backdrop, this could probably be managed a little better. I managed to get it in the end however this was almost right on closing time and the lighting was not the best.

It was a Monday when we visited but as with most other venues in Vietnam I would recommend getting there right as the gates open to avoid the crowds.

data.formatted_address: 9A Hồ Xuân Hương, Phường 9, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66000, Vietnam
data.name: Đà Lạt Youth Prison Museum

reviews.text: The former youth prison in Dalat. It’s said that the French colonial government and the South Vietnam region would send youth prisoners there to torture. According to the photos many of the prisoners would likely be only 12-13. There’re English illustrations as well as audio guidance.

Very realistic and informative. I didn’t finish the museum because I felt too sad and scared. I was alone on a Saturday afternoon. But the true stories of hell on earth really shakened me. Good for tourist who wants real cultural historical impact.

This place plays a very important role in the city’s history. The realistic displays really terrified me. How can people survive in such conditions, especially the young ones! Nowadays, no more bloody events, parts of the place were turned into children playground and flower gardens. The past really is behind us now.

Nice and quiet museum, you can scan a QR code to hear about the history and stories of the place, but it's in Vietnamese only I guess. It was an emotional and historical place that gives Vietnamese a sense of pride. The entry ticket is 15K
Interesting place with realistic statues and clear descriptions.

data.formatted_address: Tổ 16 thôn 1, Tà Nung, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Mongo Land Dalat

reviews.text:
Mongo Land Dalat is a brand new check-in location about 15km southwest of Dalat city center.  From the city center, you will pass by Van Thanh flower village and then experience the super beautiful winding road of Ta Nung pass.  After about 30 minutes of driving, you will reach Mongo Land, known as the little Mongolia of Dalat.  This place possesses an airy and extremely large space.  Covered by rolling mountains and hills, in the distance are vast coffee farms interspersed among windy pine hills.  This is a place highly appreciated by tourists and is an extremely ideal destination for young travelers.  Especially families with children are looking for a spacious space away from the hustle and bustle of the city.  Mongo Land Dalat is a place to enjoy moments of true relaxation after stressful working days.
The miniature landscapes at Mongo Land Dalat are arranged in an extremely scientific way.  Create thousands of super cute virtual check-in corners.  Such as Mongolian tent area, windmill, nomadic fire stove, cactus desert... Mongo Land Dalat has everything like lawns, gardens, lakes, pet farms... Come  With this extremely attractive location, you are guaranteed to have a great set of photos!  Although all the miniatures at Mongo Land Dalat are artificial, the layout is extremely skillful.  Making visitors here feel like they are living in the vast steppe of real nomadic boys and girls.

I loved Mongo Land! There was a great aviary where you walk in with some bird seed and the bird will eat out of your hand ... many beautiful and exotic varieties ...a baby camel was roaming free with a guide ... an intricate and large bunny run with little houses ... archery, a large group slide with short lines ... price of admission includes a drink... bring an umbrella as there is not shade everywhere ... Great place for pictures and videos and meandering around the property. A good place to spend 3 or 4 relaxing hours with a occasional moments of excitement.

Animal park and games here. I spent an exotic day in the đà lạt countryside. Toboggan-sled with guaranteed sensations, fun to do. A beautiful, fun, colorful day and photo memories.

You can try traditional costumes also but it's too pricey.

One entrance ticket (including 1 drink) only 100.000 VND per person for all activities. Nice place with many beautiful corners for great photos. There are so many animal such as pigmy goat, camel, alpaca, rabbit, sheep, dog, bird, iguana. So many activities you can do like sliding, archery, feeds the animal. The view is beautiful . Recommended !

Very crowded. Great place for pictures and interacting with animals. Please be mindful of the beautiful landscape and provide more trash cans and encourage patrons to be respectful and responsible for their waste.

data.formatted_address: Đà Lạt Plateau, Phước Thành, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lam Dong, Vietnam
data.name: Đà Lạt Plateau

reviews.text: Weather is cool
ok
It's a nice day, so there's beauty that can't be captured by the eyes.
Tickets are quite expensive, many beautiful shooting angles, airy and spacious

Discovered by explorer-doctor Alexandre Yersin, Lam Vien Plateau (also known as Lang Biang Plateau, Lang Bian Plateau, Lang Buong Plateau, Da Lat Plateau, Dalat Plateau) is a plateau in Central Highlands, Vietnam, with an average altitude of about 1,500 m above sea level. In the south of the plateau there is Da Lat city. The east and southeast slope down to the Da Nhim river valley, the southwest drops suddenly to the Di Linh plateau. The area is about 1,080 km². The terrain is hilly and mountainous with slopes ranging from 8-10°. There are high peaks here such as Bi Doup (2,287 m), Lang Biang (or Chu Cang Ca, 2,167 m), Hon Giao (2,010 m). River water on the plateau flows slowly; The blocked places spread out into lakes such as Xuan Huong lake, Than Tho lake, Da Thien lake, Dan Kia lake (Suoi Vang), and Cam Ly waterfall. On the edge of the plateau there are large waterfalls such as Pren (Prenn), Gu Ga, Ankrôet, Voi waterfall. Beautiful scenery, fresh climate suitable for growing temperate vegetables and fruits all year round, with large areas of three-needle pine and five-needle pine forests.
The miracle that creates the beauty of the Lang Biang plateau is the typical year-round cool weather and light fog spreading everywhere, making this land even more beautiful and charming. Associated with the Lam Vien Lam Dong plateau is the Lien Khang plateau and the Dran - Phi Nom valley at lower altitudes. Although the base of the plateau is rocky, the topographic surface here has a typical plateau-semi-plateau shape. Lang Biang Plateau has a cool climate, fresh all year round but there is still a rainy season. The rainy season lasts from May to October. During the rainy season, fog often appears, and both valleys and plateaus seem to be covered with a beautiful and mysterious thin film. In particular, this place is known as the paradise of fruits and vegetables. This plateau is suitable for growing fruit trees such as strawberries, plums, oil, radishes, lettuce, artichokes, onions, potatoes... Besides, there are also many animal species such as elephants, leopards, brocades, etc. bison…and smaller animals.

data.formatted_address: 16 Trần Hưng Đạo, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Cadasa Resort

reviews.text: Very beautiful and comfy 🥰 we enjoyed our stay. Good breakfast a la cart and really helpful service too

The second of new year 2021
We had buffet breakfast at Cadasa resort after my sister and my wife had taken some pictures around Xuan Huong lake at the dawn.
The first destination we came to is the Crazy House that has designed by Dang Viet Nga architect. We just had known that she is the third daughter of the president of Viet Nam party Le Duan. Unluckily, our younger daughter Bat got sick there, so all of us couldn’t explore the entire house.
We stopped at “Hồi Nớ” restaurant that is highly recommend to eat lunch. There were so many many people there to eat and check in. As we thought, the food was good and the service was comfortable too. There, there was many nice Corners for young people to take their own photos. Some of them that try to imitate 80-90s model.
My little daughter continued having a fever and she must take the cure from my wife. At this time, the rest of us went to the vegetarian restaurant for dinner. I had a headache since I already had had high blood pressure some days ago.
And now, we are folding our clothes for coming back home tomorrow.
The long trips, someone has sick so we couldn’t come to remaining destinations as our plan, but the period we have each other is the most important...

Amazing view with a lovely garden. Was good to hear the birds singing in the morning . The rooms have classic high ceilings with baths in most of them. The host let us check out late and they had bikes to rent if you need. Good value for money location which is central to everything.

A very unique set of mostly over 100 years French and Nouveau Art style villas - some of them is having a valuable contemporary history of country across 50 years of wars - in a best greeny and not congested area of Dalat with beautiful views to the town. But lacking of professional management for taking care of buildings - maybe budget reason - and trained staff services.

This was the only place we could find in Dalat with a reasonable sized room. The rooms are huge for the price, but that's because the buildings are old and in need of renovation.
All the facilities function perfectly, but the place feels old. The decor is old. The colours are old. The rooms are dark.
A good interior decorator could convert this place into a stunning resort.
Great place for large groups who can bring it to life. But a bit depressing for lonely singles or couples.
Very quiet at night. Good bed.

data.formatted_address: XCHW+5RH, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Amusement Park

reviews.text: Dalat's amusement park had a lot to see, and the parks on the top of the mountain were well-maintained, so it was a fun place to visit. The experience of duck boats floating on the lake was fun, and the miniatures modeled after famous overseas buildings were amazing. Also, the wooden bridge for luge experience and mountain guerrilla training was fun.

It's in TTC world. You can take the shuttle, but you still have to walk a bit. The ticket price is a bit high. There is a zip line and a traditional clothing experience in a very large well-maintained park. A lot of locals come to show off.

data.formatted_address: 9 Đinh Tiên Hoàng, Phường 2, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Children Amusement in Lam Dong Province

reviews.text: Used to be a Christian college til 1975 and it changed to Children Culture House til now. The place itself is beautiful with modernist architect; very big with many rooms. At the weekend, many classes and activities for kids here.
Beautiful & romantic place not only for children but also for adults to relax while waiting for their kids playing & studying (music, painting, martial arts...)
Great place for kids to consume their energy
Nice open space with lots of playground equipment. The playground is free, but there is also a small fair with paid tickets (around 10,000 for an average ride)
Free

data.formatted_address: QL20 Đèo Prenn, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66000, Vietnam
data.name: Datanla Waterfall

reviews.text: I wasn’t thinking that this area would be like this, I thought it’s gonna be more natural with trees, waterfall and the view, like wild nature. But I can see that it doesn’t really look like what I expected before. However, so far so good. Maybe need some more creative ideas for activities or the view around the attraction. For the location of the attraction little bit far from city centre, so if you take a public transport like a grab bike, maybe you should thinking about how you get back to city centre because not a lot of them available, or other option is you just rent motorbikes by yourself.

This is a must-do attraction at Dalat so it’s very popular and mostly crowded.
Best to arrive as early as possible to take the alpine coaster as the queue can be very long.
The alpine coaster is very thrilling and fun.
Good to go on a solo ride.
Kids can ride with their parents.
It’s easy to control the alpine coaster cart.
It will only move when the two handles are pushed forward with the hands. So there is no danger of the cart just sliding down on its own out of control. It is also possible to control the speed of the cart depending on how much the handles are pushed forward.
The ride is very exhilarating but remember to slow down at the bends for safety sake, and do not attempt to use mobile phone to take photographs or videos as both hands need to be holding the cart handles…
Make sure to smile at the camera point to have a nice photo taken.
The photos can be viewed and bought after the ride up from a booth near the entrance.
Those who don’t wish to ride on the alpine coaster can walk down to the waterfall using the stairs… which is not as fun and easy as the alpine coaster.

Let me tell you about Datanla Waterfall in Da Lat. It wasn't quite what I pictured, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The waterfall itself is beautiful – a series of cascades down a rocky cliff, surrounded by lush green forest. It's smaller than I expected, but that makes it more intimate. The air is fresh and cool, and the sound of the water is incredibly calming.

The thing that surprised me most was the "tourist complex" vibe. There's an alpine coaster that zooms through the trees, which looked like a blast, but definitely not the peaceful escape I was hoping for. There's also a cable car down to the falls, which is convenient, but takes away from the adventure a bit.  If you're looking for a quiet, secluded waterfall experience, this might not be it.

But listen, if you're up for a fun day out with a bit of everything, then Datanla is a great choice. The falls are lovely, the activities are exciting, and the whole place is very well-maintained.  I just recommend going in with the right expectations – it's more of a theme park with a waterfall than a wild, hidden wonder.

just for the record. i took only entry level for 50k without coasters, climbing, etc

but waterfall looked really poor and overcrowded. even at 9am there are lots of tourists taking photo of this small waterfall

it’s not so bad, but everyone told me that this one is the best in da lat. didn’t meet any of my expectations. wouldn’t go again definitely

If you come to these falls, don't skip the Alpine Coaster! It was my favorite part of our visit to Da Lat! Good for all ages, even children. You control your speed yourself so you can go slowly with children, but if your like me, and want to get that adrenaline rush, wait till the line dies down, and let the families get far ahead of you. Once the track is more clear, hit it! You can get some good speed on this thing, it's so fun I almost wanted to do it twice. The waterfall at the bottom is great, make sure to hike down to the second fall though, much bigger and less crowded.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Trần Quốc Toản, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Lâm Viên Square

reviews.text:
This place is the must visit Place of Dalat. Vietnam

You may come here with your own vehicle or Grab, official Parking available with fee.

AC Market is also there to visit Food Court, Grocery, Super Mart, and Branded Store are there .

You may have a look of this place and in garden you may have good time with your family and Friends

You may get Corn, sweet Potato for registration and Pork and Chiken for Non Vegetarian through local vendors..

Recommend to visit this place whenever you are being to Dalat.
Really nice day trip out. The cinema was good but the seats were not comfy. The shopping mall was really large and lots of different stalls. Definitely worth a visit

This location is also an iconic spot to visit in Da Lat. You can go there during the day or at night, both times are beautiful and captivating. At night, you can sit there and enjoy watching families and children playing around.

Supposed to be among the gems of Dalat but was a sad, eerie scene of beautiful doggos forced into tourist photo ops and a handful of strawberry vendors. Oddly, vendors weren't allowed on the main steps and square, leaving it to seem dead. Instead, the vendors are across the street on the sidewalk along the lake, forcing pedestrians into oncoming traffic.
Then, there's the laughable, bizarre design choice of the two main buildings... 🍑🕳️+🍑🔌

Edit: less dead when it wasn't raining.

Popular spot across locals, very lively towards sunset time & interesting to see how locals live and entertain. They charge parking for scooters on the lake side, but free on the other end towards the back. It was a bit sad to see how dogs are used for photos.

data.formatted_address: Đường Mai Anh Đào, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Valley Of Love

reviews.text: Visited this place during mid day, there are lots of beautiful photo spot in this place. You can strolling around in this place and see lots of beautiful flowers. You can also visit glass bridge with additional entrance fee

Forget those one-star sour grapes; this place is a gem! Sure, tickets are a tad pricey at 250k, but trust me, it's worth every dong. And waiting for a buggy? Not really, you'll be cruising within 10 minutes, tops.

Let's set the record straight: no favoritism against Westerners; they just wait for a full buggy. Fair's fair!

Didn't splurge on extras, but still had a blast! With plenty to see and do included in the standard ticket. Soaking up the sun, admiring the garden art, or checking out the miniature world wonders, there's never a dull moment this place is beautiful.

We had a chillaxed day, perfect for bonding with your partner or simply unwinding. Oh, and if you want to kick off your day with a bang, we hit the Clay Tunnels first thing in the morning and then Valley of Love in the afternoon, it’s around 30 minutes to get to each on scooter. Would recommend!

Two adults and a child cost VND650,000 to enter and walk around a park with extremely tacky plastic and nylon covered monuments from cities around the world, like a miniature Eiffel Tower or Statue of Liberty.  The ticket office stated there were carts to drive the guests around the park on tours, but there were none.  If you want to walk across the glass-bottom bridge, that will cost you about another VND200K per person.  From the moment we entered we were constantly harassed by picture salesmen trying to get us to dress up for souvenir photos.  There is a "wax museum" with discolored and disfigured mannequins of Donald Trump, Lionel Messi, Sylvester Stallone, Prince William and Kate, etc.  Don't expect Madame Tussauds...what you get is more like Madame Commodes.   It's really tacky and poorly cared for.  My six year old son repeatedly summed up our experience perfectly: "we got scammed." It's simply not worth your money or your afternoon.  There are a few nice garden pieces and love/heart themed photo spots.  Some of the flowers and the hedgerow maze is actually a redeeming asset of the park.  Unfortunately, although the park is in Dalat, the city of flowers, this park has a garden of plastic tulips "planted"...it's actually quite absurd and typifies how tacky this place really is.
Beautiful place to visit for pictures. Cost 250k for adults. Free shuttle inside. Sugar cane drink was 20k good price. Bring a hat or umbrella for the hot sun .

It costed me 250,000 VND for only entrance.
The park is huge. You can take buggy for point to point.
Not quite sure to recommend this place
But, it is quite good.

data.formatted_address: Trai Mat, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lam Dong, Vietnam
data.name: Linh Phuoc Pagoda

reviews.text: Beautiful pagoda,fantastic scenery and iconic statues. To see something like this here is amazing. Almost captivating. I recommend it if you come to Dalat🙏

Took the bus here on a sat late morning. No. 6. Ticket price 10k. The bus stops directly at the alley to the temple, just need to walk 2 minutes to reach the temple ground.
Temple is interesting with intricate design. You can climb up a pagoda for better view. Folks also make wishes and knock the bell.
When tour buses come, it gets really crowded and noisy.

Large temple with lots of tourists. It looks like this is one of the stops for group tours. I drove here from the center and it took about 20 minutes and there is a free parking at the temple. It is an unique temple, but there were so many tourists at the time of my visit, which was arund 4pm on a weekday.

It’s such a unique temple. For temple lovers it’s a must see, full of beauty and spirituality. It is very touristy so maybe the morning would be a better time to visit. The shrines are different to any I’ve seen before. It is a Hindu temple so is different from the standard Buddhist temples. Definitely worth visiting, free parking also. The temple was also free to enter! The temple also consists of a shop with some cool souvenirs, with an underground spooky walkthrough.

We were here on May 16th, 2024.
This place is absolutely amazing and well worth the trip which is only 20 minutes out of Da Lat. We took a motorbike and grab taxi will cost you quite a lot to get there and probably charge you double to get back so I recommend renting a motorbike for the day. Parking is free and there is no charge at all to go in and around all the temples and it absolutely was spectacular.

data.formatted_address: 120 Nguyễn Văn Trỗi, Phường 2, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Linh Son Pagoda

reviews.text: No entrance fee. Big and colorful sculptures. A lot to see.
This peaceful pagoda is an easy walk from the center of Da Lat. It's worth a stop if you're in the area.
Quiet place, some things are being redone, garden was very brown and dry, maybe it’s prettier in the rainy season.
Peaceful and ornate pagoda to have a quiet stroll. There's a school nextdoor, so you may hear and see the kids playing in the front. Worth a visit if you're in the neighborhood.
A beautiful atmospheric temple with plenty to see. Of course the pagoda itself is stunning, but the gardens and shrines are also beautiful, and the atmosphere calm and meditative.

data.formatted_address: Cam Ly, Phường 7, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Puppy Farm

reviews.text:
Let me start by saying this - Puppy Farm was adorable.  Cuddling with fluffy husky puppies and watching corgis zoom around a field?  Definitely heartwarming.  They have a ton of different breeds, so there's a good chance you'll find your favorite pup to play with.

But, here's the thing.  It felt a little… manufactured cute, you know?  The enclosures seemed kind of small, and some of the puppies seemed a bit tired of all the attention.  Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying they were neglected, but it wasn't quite the free-roaming puppy paradise I was expecting.

Also, the place is way bigger than it needs to be.  We spent ages walking through these giant fields of flowers that, while pretty, felt a little out of place.  And the line for the strawberry picking was insane!  Maybe it's because we went on a weekend, but it felt less like a farm and more like a theme park with puppies.

Overall, it was a cute way to spend an afternoon, but if you're looking for a genuine farm experience, this might not be it.  If you just want to shower some adorable pups with love?  Puppy Farm is your place.  Just be prepared for crowds and maybe bring some extra patience.

What the Happiness!!! Omgosh, we had the BEST time coming here. We had no idea what to expect… and we were just so happy that we went.

Parking was 5000k vnd and tickets were 100k vnd per person.

The first area that you get to is all the dogs - you can walk in and the attendant will give you some dog food to feed the dogs. The dogs were so healthy, clean, and happy. We sat and played for hours with them. There are big dogs on one side and smaller dogs on the other. It was so nice and refreshing to see how the well the animals here are treated.

The attendants clean up after all of the animals immediately. That was impressive. The animals are amazingly well mannered. We were just in heaven all day.

There is an area for Shetland ponies, a camel, Lamas, goats and you could feed and pet all of them. The carrots were 10k I think.

The farm has a beautiful garden area, places to eat, and shop.

Everything was absolutely perfect. We will for sure return one more time before we leave Da Lat.

Thank you for loving and taking care of all of this beautiful animals.

For more adventures follow us on YouTube @eyecool

It could have been better because the road leading to this place is so so bumpy and dusty. Felt like scam because they didn’t warn us about the rest time of animals during ticket buying - I enter and it was almost noon, the staff inside then inform us we must not disturb the animals during 12PM to around 1:30PM or something. So I didnt have anything to do except taking pictures with the flower field.
This is the best farm ever I love the dogs it’s super cute, there are a lot more interesting stuff like flower gardens and other animals I recommend going here!

Excellent farm, beautiful dogs, very friendly staff especially Lai!

Strawberries were delicious and the vibe was amazing, would highly recommend!

data.formatted_address: Số 162 Đường Thánh Mẫu, Phường 7, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Nhật Strawberry garden

reviews.text:
I love this place! The people are very friendly and sincere. Despite the language barrier, the women looking after the strawberries tried to guide us on picking the berries and offered us to eat some which they had plucked. And the strawberries are super delicious - almost comparable to those I had in Japan. There is no entrance fees to look at the strawberries- but you can buy those that you plucked.

My highlight was the petting zoo. It was simple, clean, well organised and very authentic. The animals (horses, pigs, rabbits, goats, cows etc) all looked very happy and healthy - well taken care of with love. The guide was also very friendly and showed us around the place; introducing the different animals and their names and personality. Also, you get to feed the animals too - using grass and grains - instead of animal feeds. It felt really nice and was very fun! Entrance fee is required here and we were provided complimentary “animal feed”.

I definitely recommend a visit! They also have two very cute and playful dogs!!

Excellent strawberry farm. It even has its own animal petting section, great for kids. This strawberry farm is enormous with different greenhouses to pick strawberries. Each with its own conveniently located wash room. The strawberries were nice and tasted great. We were told they are organic. The main entrance also sells dried food and prepicked strawberries. Once strawberries are picked, bring the basket back to the main entrance and they will nicely pack the strawberries into a presentable tray. A must visit while in Dalat. Staff working here are friendly and helpful.
The strawberry here is really soft and sweet, the big one. 400k/ kg, no entrance fee!

Good place to experience collecting strawberries by yourself. My very first impression is how friendly the staff are, they are willing to tell us how to collect delicious strawberries as well as where to collect them best. Secondly, they grow fresh and clean Korean and Japanese strawberries which you can eat without wash it! Moreover, the packing process also noticeable! They pack each strawberry carefully with tissue and bubble wrap into a carbon box which is the best way to protect strawberries and maintain the freshness while travelling. Because we have to walk on soil paths,  I recommend avoiding wearing white clothes and collecting strawberries after rain, otherwise, you will be soaking wet and dirty.

Tidy, clean strawberry and tomato garden, 5km away from city center, with reasonable price (300,000-400,000 vnd/kg) (compare with japanese strawberry sell in supermarket with price around 500,000 vnd/kg). Ms Thao the landlord is friendly and welcoming. A well worthy experience to try.

data.formatted_address: Hồ Tuyền Lâm, Phường 4, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Lavenderdalat Gardens

reviews.text: Im not sure about the room, services or facilities in this hotel, but I came here only to see the Lavender Gardens. The location might be little bit far from the main road and city center, but it’s really worth it for the view. This garden surrounded by a lake and across the lake there is hills or maybe small mountain and forest which I don’t know the name because I came here very late in the afternoon that almost night fall. I can see that all the staff there really look after the places carefully, from the restaurants, public restroom, or even the pedestrian access to and from the garden are clean and good to see. Im not sure that we need to pay or no for the entrance ticket but they didn’t charge me money and just let me go even lead me to the lavender garden itself, they are so so friendly. This place is very recommended for people who likes quite places, and likes to be in nature like Lavender Da Lat Gardeb

Had to pay 150k pp just to see the place. Unfortunately right now there are a lot of construction sites so it is not really nice to walk there and just overpriced. At least one drink were included and the view from the Café is nice

If you're looking for a quiet, peaceful place, this is the perfect hideout. Every day, you get to wake up with the sound of birds chirping, the relaxing view of the lake, and the smell of fresh trees! Our stay here was even better as we had our dog with us. Seeing him run freely in the gardens and the lake was priceless! He got to befriend the local dogs (although some can be aggressive at first so you have to keep an eye on them).

The food and coffee prepared by the staff were great -- each day, they informed us about the menu and we were always surprised by the amount and quality of food they prepared.

If you're planning to visit here because of the lavender alone, make sure to go when it's in season! Still, the other flowers also look really nice, as well as the view of the lake too!

Would definitely go back!

Had a great team retreat at this beautiful place.
Nice atmosphere, clear air and great bird chirping wake you up in the morning
We came at bad time, they are re planting the flowers, kind of closed but the staffs at gate gave us a free entrance. Nice walk around, great view of the lake. Staffs were friendly.

data.formatted_address: Đ. Trần Quốc Toản, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Lam Vien Square

reviews.text:
This is a very beautiful place around evening. Lots of people jogging near the lake and lots of vendor and husky owner bring their dogs here for visitor to take photos with some charges.

The dogs are beautiful but I don't want to comment whether they are being trained   in a cruel way or not.  Personally I will not pay to take photos with them like I will not pay to go to the zoo for animals in captivity. It's all up to everyone.  No judgement.

The Go Dalat is definitely a landmark especially when it lids up at night.  It looks like pineapple to me but I believe it is actually bamboo shoots.  You decide.

The supermarket is packed with locals.  Is it because this is the only supermarket or hypermarket around?  I'm not sure. We thought of coming in here to hide from the cool winter wind, but it is too stuffy in here.  That's why we decided to leave.

When we reach the opera house, there are kids showing off their skateboarding skill.   The opera house is lid up but I doubt there is any performance.

This place is great but the sky is getting dark and cold. we are hungry for another vietnamese dinner.

This time, the lao. Hotpot.

Lots of people abuse dogs here to get pics for visitors, saw 1 guy sit down with his dog to punch him in his side to hide what he was doing. Hope these people will get the same treatment some day

*Updated with video proof
Beautiful place for sit peacefully and enjoy the lake view and its also have a shopping center , movie and food available here.
Nice place to hang out. Have various activities. Underground mall with facilities there also.
Remember to take on a coat as it is quite cold there

data.formatted_address: Dalat, Lam Dong, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat

data.formatted_address: Tuyền Lâm Lake, Phường 4, Dalat, Lam Dong, Vietnam
data.name: Tuyền Lâm Lake

reviews.text:
Travelers coming to enjoy nature please take note before coming/booking: swimming isn't allowed because "people have died in it before," kayaks and sup boards are hard to come by, either you book a guided tour in the city center, however if you want to rent solo for 1-2 hours you still pay 300-600k (someone has lost their mind, renting a scooter for a day is cheaper). Additionally, large ugly resorts have gated off and developed a large part of the lakeshore, well other "hidden" areas are littered with trash, but if you can look past that fact and try to get closer to the water, I've been told locals will report you.

So yes, this lake is romantic and scenic, however, it isn't what it seems. It did offer me a nice drive, although you can encircle the entire lake. Over all, this experience was so disappointing for a natural-born lake girl.
Driving a motorbike around the lake is a great choice. Beautiful road.

very beautiful lake and landscape worth visiting 💯 we visited together with truc lam monastery and got there using cable car 👍🏻
pity it was raining very bad when we went so couldn’t really enjoy 😢 we would have wanted to join the boat tour or even just boat paddling 😢

Spent a delightful day at this peaceful lakeside location. The scenic view of the mountains and the clear water created a perfect backdrop for relaxation. We enjoyed some boating, which was both fun and reasonably priced. It's an excellent spot for families or anyone looking to escape the city's hustle and bustle for a few hours. Highly recommend for a refreshing day!!!

It's beautiful.The best way you travel in DALAT is take a motorbike.If the weather is fine only 6 hours (rent half day VND100.000) is enough.i'm luck yesterday morning is shining day,although is a rain season.temperature is 20℃.

reviews.text: View is great but we went there waiting for the sunset however there was no visible sunset… Abit disappointed but we still had the hill to ourselves and the view was pretty awesome too! You can have a small picnic here too :)

You should ride to the peak of this hill
This is a challenge
you should arrive before 7AM

It's pretty much a peaceful hill. I went there with 2 friends of mine for the sunset, and I love it. We stay until the sun goes down, a chill weather, nice sunset and a bit away from city... Just love it.

We came for the sunset and waited there for a while it was  a really nice atmosphere!! A tiny hike up the hill but we did the rest by motorbike 🏍️. Our sunset view was ruined by clouds but it was still amazing!

Not too difficult to reach.
The view is really nice, you can go there for camping and enjoying the sunrise & sunset.
I also saw rubbish there, maybe there was someone coming and leave there. So, remember to take rubbish with you after coming to the hill for a cleaner view :D

Very cool and private place, good for kids. There is elephant for ride. Also that is a good spot for sunset sight-seeing if you lucky enough but not so foggy and wind blows cast party cloud hide sun away

Do not support places that abuse animals! Elephants should never be exploited for tourism.

reviews.text: Nice forest with fresh air. The pine forest is very beautiful, the natural scenery is still unspoiled, the whispering pine is very wonderful, you should go camping here once to enjoy life.
Beautiful place with a beauftiful bistro! It is a bit on the expensive sode but the ambiance is exquisite!

Seems to be public uncontolled access to the gorgeous pine forest around the lake and a popular spot for picnics.

You can walk down to the edge of the lake from here.

Unfortunately a lot of litter is gathered courtesy of the pigs who dont know how to care for their own greatest gifts.
Beautiful

The most beautiful pine forest in Da Lat, suitable for checking in and relaxing, inside there is a camping area and a quite chill cafe, the entrance is on the way to the sculpture tunnel, running around Tuyen Lam lake then stopping by the pine forest is an option. Interesting choice when coming to Da Lat

data.formatted_address: 45 Đường Đặng Thái Thân, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Maple Leaf tourist area

reviews.text: Beautiful area to chill and take some pictures. There are nice ponds with lots of hungry fish. They can sell you the food to feed the fish but I suggest you take it with you because the price is probably 10x higher than outside (I'm talking about fish food only).

Psudeo-Japanese village targeted at Saigonese tourists. Primarily for vanity and phototaking with a number of manmade photospots. Unfortunately some farmer nearby was burning stuff so valley view was obscured by smoke. Not worth the 80k entry for those who have been to the real Japan.

Only recommend to come here to take photos if you are willing to pay a small entrance fee.

Scenery was beautiful given it was a mini Japan and honestly the area wasn’t huge. Food wasn’t great as well with limited options.

Nice to visit but won’t come back again after experiencing it once.
Like a small Japan here, nice decoration, I really like Koi fishes here, colorful and big. Good to try!

It's a Japanese park lookalike that's pretty well done.  It's not Japan obviously but you do get a very nice koi pond and lots of reminders of Japan. One of my favorite facsimiles in Dalat.  Plenty of photo spots.

data.formatted_address: 1 Ngô Quyền, Phường 6, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Domaine de Marie

reviews.text: This beautiful Pink Church is located in the middle of Dalat city. The air is filled with the sweet scent of blossoming flowers, creating an atmosphere of serenity and calm. As you step into its tranquil garden, you will see a kaleidoscope of colors, with vibrant flowers adorning every corner. Whether you're a nature lover or simply seeking a peaceful retreat, a visit to this picturesque church is a must when exploring Dalat city.

We visited last Sep 1 which was a holiday. It was still open and NO entrance fee since this is open for all. Upon entering it was nice, since there are trees and flowers to calm your soul. The orange colour of the Church makes it more beautiful. A lot of tourist take picture in front of Church, try to get inside too since it is nice though it was not that big to gather during mass. Good thing about the Church is that they have a store beside it. Don't miss to go there. You could buy a lot of knitted clothes that are way cheaper from other market plus it's BRAND NEW. We've seen some of people inside doing these products maybe that is why it is cheaper. Also, paintings were available inside.
Picturesque church. Not much to see/do besides taking photos of the building so 15 minutes here was sufficient.

Catholic church in Dalat with unique architecture and design which create interesting light shade and shadow.

One of peaceful places to visit.
The space is quiet, the church grounds are well cared for and very beautiful.

data.formatted_address: 1 Đường Triệu Việt Vương, Phường 4, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Dinh III Bảo Đại

reviews.text: An interesting visit. It was calm and almost empty. The garden is big, but not too big. I wish there were more flowers around. The building served the last emperor of the Nguyen dynasty. The architecture itself is not too old since it was built around the 30's. You can visit freely and without being disturbed as there was almost no staff during our short tour that lasted around 60 minutes.

An electric card is issued to use the turnstile to enter. Ticket is 60k. Just one building and a pretty garden to visit. Gotta wear a shoe cover while you are inside the mansion. The king and his family had a great life in the past.
Washroom is located outside in a separate building around 50m away. Parking is 3k.

Interesting historical place, kept in good condition. I wish you would learn more about it. There are only a few boards scattered around the palace.

The garden is very nice and it’s cool inside, good to escape the mid day heat.

They doubled their price as of April 1st 2024 it’s 60k pP

This is a museum. When I entered this place, I just thought "The King and Queen they have a very beautiful palace" the interior inside the building is a mixture of classic European interiors and touches of Vietnamese culture. really awesome. walked down the hall and saw the living room area, bedroom in the palace. the decoration is beautiful and even very up to date. The areas on the left and right and sides of the building are full of flowering plants, typical of Da Lat. In my opinion, Da Lat is the only beautiful city full of flowers in Vietnam.
Inside there will be people offering you to take photos wearing traditional Vietnamese costumes. the price is 90,000 VND. After taking the photo, if you want to print it, the price given is around 50,000 VND per photo. printing costs are a bit expensive. but you can refuse if you don't want to

Ticket price for adult is 60000VND, double of what stated here. A nice place to visit and learn about french influenced architecture on a rainy day. Overall I'm just not very happy with the ticket pricing ambiguity.

data.formatted_address: WCV9+G3P, 8b Đường Hoàng Văn Thụ, Phường 5, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Cam Ly Waterfall

reviews.text: It’s very sad to see the pollution here. The facilities were likely once quite beautiful, now they are very run down. You will see a poor old horse tied up closely to a rail next to the smelly polluted waters and your heart will break. In the photos they don’t look so bad but you will see trash in the waters and the smell is instant. It’s a short scooter ride from town but truly not worth it. From the moment we walked in our hearts sank at the conditions.

Horses tied up with no water and covered in itchy flies with not enough slack to even itch their whole body. You can see their ribs, and they're shivering in pain. I should've read to reviews, and feel sick for supporting this. Do not come here.

It was the worst waterfall in my life. The smell is awful. Unfortunately, I rarely read reviews. But I hope, that mine one will help to someone not to go there.  The waterfall itself beautiful and anusual shape. It could be much better without that smell and trash.

And if you look to the water- you can see the white foam. This means that there are some household chemicals in the water - washing powder, shampoo and etc. So, this is exactly canalisation…  Canalisation waterfall

The city government must correct the situation!!! Where is ecological workers? It’s awful, really awful. This is disaster!

I come to Dalat only for visiting famous waterfalls, and I'm worried about the others now

Not sure if these foams are formed naturally or is an indicator for water pollution. Ticket costs 40,000 VND per person and have nothing to see inside this attraction. Very smelly as it could be the downstream of the river and nearby neighborhoods. Not recommended for tourists

Do not visit this place! 40k for tickets. They have a horse tied up on short reigns at the edge of the Waterfall for "photo opportunities". No access to food or WATER in 27°C heat. Cruel. Regret paying them money. Staff dumping piles of plastic waste straight into the water. Disgraceful

data.formatted_address: 8, 39 Đường Phù Đổng Thiên Vương, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Thiền viện Vạn Hạnh

reviews.text:
The location has potential for serenity, but it's marred by an overwhelming collection of artifacts that lack cohesion.

The excessive number of benches, engraved with Russian names, detracts from the intended ambiance.

It's difficult to determine if the space is meant for meditation or serves another purpose.
Beautiful and peaceful temple complex with a serene garden full of flowers. Impressive statues.

This is a very special place and well worth the walk from the city centre. It is far more majestic in real life than the camera can capture. There are 3 large golden Buddhas, beautiful gardens and rich temples. It's a peaceful spot and also has some lovely views out over the city. It's a nice walk to the temple, with lots of good bubble milk tea shops along the route!
Free parking and entrance! It takes 10 minutes top to visit. There's a temple and a big Buddha statue, but it's worth it to visit!

I recently had the opportunity to visit the Golden Buddha Pagoda and I was thoroughly impressed by its beauty and serenity. The pagoda is a stunning example of traditional Buddhist architecture, with intricate details and striking golden sculptures adorning the exterior.

Upon entering the pagoda, I was greeted by the warm and peaceful energy that seemed to permeate the air. The main hall was magnificent, with a large golden Buddha statue that commanded attention with its size and radiant beauty. The intricate carvings and detailed paintings on the walls added to the awe-inspiring atmosphere, making it a truly spiritual experience.

One of the standout features of this pagoda was the tranquil gardens surrounding it, with serene ponds and lush greenery adding to the peaceful environment. It was a welcome escape from the hustle and bustle of daily life and the perfect place for quiet reflection and meditation.

The pagoda also had a number of smaller shrines and altars dedicated to various Buddhist figures, each with its own unique charm and beauty. These added to the overall spiritual experience, making it an excellent destination for anyone looking to deepen their understanding of Buddhism or simply enjoy a peaceful and beautiful environment.

In conclusion, the Golden Buddha Pagoda is a must-visit for anyone in the area, whether you are a spiritual seeker, a history enthusiast, or simply looking for a tranquil escape from the world. Its beauty and peaceful energy will leave a lasting impression and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a unique and inspiring experience.

There is also a green space outside of the building to relax and enjoy the Da Lat’s beautiful weather.
Good regional museum with many unique artefacts from Cat Tien. The Koho and Empress Nam Phuong exhibitions are the highlights.
The palace of Nam Phuong Hoang Hau is really beautiful, the entry ticket cost 22K only. A definitely must-go place
Very informative, will change your perception and appreciation for Dalat. I’m grateful I came on my second day because it changed how I experience Dalat. Never a boring moment for 30mins / 1 hour.

Best service & environment to be in if you are looking for an indoor attraction in dalat. Here are some photos that she took for us ☺️

Great experience and well priced as I read the one in HCM is much more expensive! We had a lot of fun here and the staff were very helpful in taking pictures of the two of us. We were the only people there when we went so it was nice and quiet.

data.formatted_address: 7a Nguyễn Trãi, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Da Lat Railway Station

reviews.text:
This place is like stepping into a time machine, and I'm not just saying that because of the vintage steam locomotive rides—although, let's be honest, that's a big draw.

Built back in the '30s during the French colonial period, this station isn't just any old stop; it's a piece of architectural history. The design screams Art Deco with a twist, featuring three high triangular peaks that nod to the Lang Biang Mountains. It's like the building itself is trying to tell you, "Hey, we've got style and history!"

Even though the days of regular train services are long gone, the station still offers a charming short ride to Trai Mat. It's perfect for those who want to relive the golden age of train travel, or at least snap a few Instagram-worthy photos. Plus, the journey offers stunning views of the countryside that you just can't get anywhere else.

It's a delightful blend of culture, history & a dash of old-world charm.
Night train ride was amazing. Must do in Dalat. Schedule run time: 18:15, 20:15. Approx 30 mins for each trip.
This iconic location is a must-visit in Da Lat! My recommendation is to visit it in the morning when it's less crowded. It is definitely worth a visit when traveling in Da Lat! ^^
Dalat Train Station once served as a gateway to the captivating city of Dalat. If you want to experience commuting by train, you can visit Dalat Station and purchase a ticket there.

The old station building does not serve its original purpose, as you will learn further from any guidebook. what you won't know, however, is its current purpose. After paying the entrance fee, which was 10,000 VND, you have the opportunity to admire the colonial architecture. From the outside, the building is quite well preserved. in the main hall today you will only find a market with souvenirs. The accessible platforms have individual compartments parked where many visitors take photos. The interior of some coupes is interesting. If you walk about 150 meters along the platform, you will come across a modern cafe on the left, which is set in a community garden. 30 minutes is plenty for a visit.

data.formatted_address: WCPQ+RFF, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Tháp truyền hình Đà Lạt

reviews.text:
Visitors to the City of Flowers see beautiful scenery of trees and flowers everywhere, the peaceful water surface of Xuan Huong Lake, watching the high sky with white clouds drifting lazily in the sunsets, the space seems to stop. again.
Suddenly, I was surprised to see a tall tower in the distance, tilting up into the sky
Startled to find it strangely similar to the Eiffel Tower
With many beautiful viewing angles, visitors feel like they are in magnificent Paris.
Waking up is the Da Lat TV Tower, cold and lonely in endless nights.
With a central location in the tourist city, the Tower is only a place to carry out technical work to serve state management without fully exploiting the hidden beauty of architecture and fine arts of the project. This.
There is a dream that one day the TV Tower will be lit up with LED strips, with a lighting system... how wonderful it would be at night.
The city of flowers will not only have flowers with romantic Xuan Huong Lake and afternoons engulfed in smog, but also a Light Tower like a lighthouse in the dark night... which will attract countless tourists, unable to bear it. leave.
Suddenly remembered the song "Are you going back to Da Lat? You're so emotional... changed to Where are you going to leave Da Lat?"
I love this city.
Dalat TV Tower

data.formatted_address: 116 Xô Viết Nghệ Tĩnh, Phường 7, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Scientific Research Institute of Highland

reviews.text:
For sure one of the most obscure places I have ever been to in my life, but for some reason it was oddly satisfying.

First you pay at a small building along the road that leads to the main building, we past it but the man came out and yelled for us to come pay. Adult 15000 children free.

The main building is massive and it is beautiful, a shame that the inside is not very well taken care of but in a way that adds to the mystery of the place.

The museum is just about 10-15 rooms of taxidermy. The main one houses an elephant and it’s skeleton which is interesting.

The chocolate factory at the ground floor just adds to how weiiiiiiird this place is!!!!! But we bought some anyway.

I’d recommend it though if you are looking for something to do. Many people were there just to take photos, for sure many places to do that.

Lovely day out here!
The museum is a very good for a quick visit  with with your children, entertaining and educational looking at exhibitions. Besides you can stroll around the building for some pictures and get a hot chocolate for the finish touch.
A wonderful place for a date. Quiet, serene, and filled with fascinating things. The old charm of the building makes it very attractive, and the outside is simply beautiful for a walk.
Just made a quick call (22-Jul-2024) to enquire about the opening hours, sadly the museum is currently closed to public due to maintenance until the end of the year 😔

Great place to enjoy the quiet surroundings of Da Lat. Museum was a monastery before 1975, and you still get that feeling while walking through the hallways. Collection might look a bit outdated or old, the painted backgrounds and Vietnamese posters help creating a nice atmosphere.
The cafe has some great chocolate options and the view and sounds of the surrounding area will help you have a great time here.
Birders can find various birds here, don’t forget your binoculars!

data.formatted_address: 04 Đ. Hùng Vương, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Cung Nam Phương Hoàng Hậu

reviews.text:
The museum inside offers a glimpse into the life of the queen and Vietnamese history in general.

It might not be the most luxurious palace you'll ever visit (tickets are quite affordable!)

The palace grounds also feature areas dedicated to traditional Vietnamese children's games. Great way to experience a bit of local culture alongside the historical exhibits.

Overall, the Queen Nam Phuong Palace is a worthwhile visit, especially considering the reasonable ticket prices. Just be prepared for a place steeped in history rather than opulent grandeur.
Located inside the Lâm Đồng museum. It's a building with historical values. There is nothing else much to do besides looking around the garden and inside the house.

We came at 11:00 am, bought tickets (15,000 VND), climbed up to the palace, the staff said his shift finished (even though they will close at 11:30) and asked us to come back in the afternoon. We walked to the ticket booth to ask for the refund. The ticket lady said No because it was counted by the system.

It's all confusing and messy in organization, totally disappointed.
Nice

The museum was outstanding. Just being here alone feels like one is walking into the past. There are still artefacts used by the Queen, though according to the story potrayed, she didn’t stay here long. Really worth the money.

data.formatted_address: Phường 4, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Spillway of Tuyền Lâm Lake

reviews.text:
Tuyen Lam Lake is a place where nature's beauty takes center stage and leaves you in awe. Imagine sitting on a comfortable lakeside chair, holding a warm cup of coffee, as you watch the gorgeous and tranquil lake waters with the majestic mountain backdrop. It's a sight to behold and exactly what I felt, a moment of serene bliss that feels like a beautiful dream.

Add the touch and smell of the fresh chilly air - simply breathtaking.

Clearly, it's a favorite spot for Vietnamese tourists, who come here to soak in the natural beauty and spend quality time with their loved ones. It's a testament to the lake's charm and allure.

Whether you're a nature lover, a photography enthusiast, or simply someone looking for a peaceful escape from the city's hustle and bustle, Tuyen Lam Lake is the place to be. The beauty of the lake coupled with the warmth of the local people creates an experience that is both enriching and heartwarming.

So, next time you're in Dalat, make sure to visit Tuyen Lam Lake. Bring along your favorite book, pack a picnic, or simply sit back with a cup of coffee and let nature's beauty wash over you. Trust me, it's an experience you don't want to miss!

MORNING WELL SPENT

Nice place to come and sit with a drink. There is also boat hiring activities. You can 🚲 or 🛵 around the lake but sadly not a full circuit at some point you need to turn around and go back. Along the route there are many cafes and restaurants which take advantage of the views of the lake.

Would be nice if there was a walking route around the lake but sadly not.

After the cable car experience, I rode around Tuyen Lam Lake. Intended to look for lavender fields, but I was told that it was not yet the season. So I just enjoyed the scenery of the lake and the mountains .

It is an ideal place to watch the sunset. However, it is quite crowded here, so it is not suitable for those who like quiet. A note for those who want to come here is to dress a little warm because the area around the lake is quite cold. The way is easy to find and easy to go.

Its a nature park with waterfalls cascading down the hills. It was very pretty in the rain. There is a bridge with water flowing over them and you can walk over them. Just another place to visit, in case you are coming from the desert, worth a visit. You can also take a dip into the waterfall at various places. The choice of place gets better as you keep going up. The gradient and steps are made of stone and is fairly easy to negottiate.

Cold at night and very hot during the day (you cannot stay inside the tent during a hot day). The accomodations are limited, water heater was not working well during my stay. It's good for 1 night camping but I cannot recommend staying longer than that.

data.formatted_address: Khánh Sơn District, Khánh Hòa, Vietnam
data.name: Hon Ba Nature Reserve

reviews.text:
In Vietnam there is a Mr. Binh San. a man with a vision and mission. the cordiality, passion for nature is unprecedented. the love for nature too. It is beautiful how being one with nature is, away from all luxury, away from all stress and being lived. come to yourself for a moment, in short, back to your own self.

thank you Mr Binh San

You are not allowed to go to the top of Hon Ba nor Yersin’s house on your own, but instead have to buy a ticket for 300.000 vnd from the Kong Forest place and its car will take you up.
This is ridiculous as one, the Hon Ba Nature Reserve should be a public place, and two, i don’t play any of the games in Kong, why paying that much.

An amazing ride to go to the top. Nature is everywhere: pure water spring, beautiful trees and plants, the roads is very quiet and fresh. You can easily stop near the stream "suoi dau" to swim and make bbq for the lunch (don't forget your trash plz...).

As previously said the place has been closed for years. There is locked a boom gate after kong park. They really should have a sign on Google Maps and at the entry. River is pretty but there is garbage all along the way which is pretty depressing to see.
Natural untouched beauty, rent a motorbike and drive through the mountains, beautiful river and untouched forest.

data.formatted_address: 31d Khe Sanh, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: In The Forest Đà Lạt

reviews.text:
American Citizen here @visual_perspectivist

What a pleasant, peaceful scenery! The best part is you only hear the sounds of nature, no horns form the city or roads. A huge huge plus for me trying to escape the city life in Vietnam.

I had the caramel macchiato 65.000 hot and the hot Cocoa 55.000! They both were extremely delicious - I finished the Cocoa before I could even get a photo of it it was that yummy!

marvelous cafe, I always stop by this place everytime I visit Da Lat.
Drink was good, food also good, the steak/rib is well cooked, accompany by nature view, cant be  a wrong choice

The place is quite hard to reach haha. Need to go through some small roads to reach the cafe but its super worth it.

The scenery is so pretty. I like how they put a different flower in each table. We came early in the morning but I think it would be more beautiful if you came in the evening.

We want to try the steak but its not served yet because its still early. So we only ordered hot chocolate and garlic bread. The hot chocolate taste fine but they can do better with the garlic bread next time.

They also have separate menu written in English. You can ask the employee for it if its hard for you to understand the Vietnamese menu.

This cafe is literally located in the forest, but it's not too far from the center only 15 minutes away. This place was actually nicer than I thought it would be and was worth coming. They somehow don't have hot coffee, so I tried their hot ginger tea instead and it was good. The view may not be as great as some of the great view cafes in Dalat, but the overall experience here was really good.

This place was very inspiring for us. The whole energy there is just so calm, full and beautiful. I felt connected with nature and in  awesome artistic mood.

But unfortunately, there is no chance to eat for someone with crazy food allergies like me - eggs, milk and soya. I was sad about it because only thing that I could eat was ... coffee. But I really enjoyed the coffee! It was very good.

I would definitely come back and feel the charming atmosphere again. And I will. I recommend this place, this experience. (:

data.formatted_address: QL27C, Xã Đạ Nhim, Lạc Dương, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: ZooDoo Zoo

reviews.text: Few people know that this man is the owner of Zoodoo and also an expert in conservation agriculture and sustainable farming. The way he designs and organizes the zoo's activities is truly professional. He not only avoids exploiting forest resources but also preserves nature, respects the terrain, and improves the soil under the pine canopy with his farming techniques. He is always eager to share his experience and knowledge with others, though only when he has time, as he is as busy as a bee, constantly working.

the ticket price was very reasonable for what it is . the only problem was that the tour feel rushed and you can’t stay longer with some animals if you want to. i ordered three drinks while waiting and all of them were too sweet so try ask for less sugar 👍 they also offer you to take a picture with mear cat which i think was really worth it

Amazing experience. Friendly tourguide. We got to see and interact with many cute animals, especially the famous Capybara! There are also seperate zone for Corgis and Cats, so many cats (And you will have to buy another ticket to see those doggos and cattos)

This alone made my whole trip. I would love to visit again for all the lovely animals (especially the capybaras), and the cat cafe that I couldn’t go to. Huge shoutout to all the welcoming, super funny staff as well. Highly recommended!

There are many rare animals (Capybara, Raccoon, Alpaca, Tortoise, etc), all are well taken care of and friendly toward human. Staffs are kind and helpful. You should call the hotline to reserve tickets in advance in order to have the best experience. They also have a bus (80.000 VND/2-way) that can take you there directly from Da Lat city centre. Highly recommended!

data.formatted_address: 22, 3 Đường Trần Khánh Dư, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Happy Tour

reviews.text:
We had a fun packed day with our guide (Mr Chung) & driver (Vin) in a very comfy car. We managed to visit a lot of places in a matter of 7 hours- ethnic group visit, tasted crickets, weasel coffee and rice wine, visited flower farm, lady buddha, elephant waterfall and silkworm factory, and ate like and with the locals :) I highly recommend
to anyone who wishes to explore Dalat in a short time. We only had a day in Dalat and were worried that since we're going to be there on a Sunday, we will miss seeing Dalat. The tour was booked only a day before our arrival. Thank you guys :)

Thanks to Anh Viet and our two drivers for giving us 2 great tours of Dalat and its surroundings. We did a full-day private tour of Dalat's countryside and a half-day motorbike tour through the city. Anh Viet was fluent in English, very knowledgeable about Dalat and its surroundings and overall great fun. He even went out of his way to help us pick up some really nice Xôi from a street corner stall that an 84 old lady has been running for ages when we needed a packed lunch for our bus trip to Mui Ne.

Wonderful day tour, can't beat the price! Our tour guide and driver were wonderful. Highly recommend! Saw so much countryside and learned so much about the area. Tasted wonderful coffee, crickets and moonshine. Thank you 💝

I booked the food tour through their website, they responded quickly and arranged for us the tour at nighttime. We went all around Da Lat to discover all the famous local restaurants in this city. that is the great experience for me and my friends. the tour guide provided a lot of information and show us how to eat and cook these foods and their cultural cuisine. We enjoyed so much all the food we ate. thank you so much and i  highly recommended

That was an amazing day visiting Dalat. Our guide Andy take me to many places in Dalat. We go to Xuan Huong Lake, Doha coffee. And Cau Dat Farm. We have the best time Enjoy Dalat. Highly recommend Dalat Happy Tour For your travel trip.

data.formatted_address: Đường Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Da Lat Night Market

reviews.text:
I always say I don't like night market as they are too crowded and food offered is not always authentic.  I am so WRONG about this night market.  This place is so unique.

The area is huge where the entrance from roundabout until the sculpture is full of stalls mainly winter clothing and food.

If you walk to the back then you have a chance to see the local selling their produce.

You need more than a night to explore this place.

From my journey starting south to north of Vietnam, I can say that Da Lat is my favourite place to visit and stay.

What are the must try in this night market.  Strawberries with salt and chilies. I couldn't eat strawberry 🍓 just like that anymore after I tasted the local version here.

There are lots of grilled corn and sweet potatoes that taste amazing.

The local pizza pancake like street food is good as well.

And don't miss the avocado ice cream.  They taste heavenly.

Don't miss this place if you are here.

Vibrant night market primarily patronized by Viet tourists. Touts are everpresent but never become annoying. There's the typical guys advertising for restaurants and also a ton of women placing plastic sheets on curbs and staircases for patrons to sit and drink overpriced soya milk. Most street food is just OK and not cheap compared to the rest of Vietnam. Overall worth having a dinner here just to soak in the atmosphere. Traffic right outside is an absolute mess though.

There is plenty of nice food and produce on offer. You can get just about anything you like here, ranging from a jacket or pair of jeans, trinkets right through to food cooked while you wait. The egg pizza was something I really enjoyed.

Great place to hang out at night. Lots of variety of food vendors, clothes, and souvenirs vendors. Don’t be afraid to bargain as local vendor will price however they want! (If you’re a foreigner, they will up the price 3,4 times so be careful)

Big selection of food and drinks. Not sure how clean and safe these places are but definitely worth the experience!

Also beware of pick pocketing! Beware of your personal valuables. Maybe just bring enough money to spend!

Not a big night market, mainly two rows of stalls by the road. Guess here is the highlight at night, so every tourist flock to here. Surprisingly avocado and vanilla ice cream (20k) go quite well. But the portion is little. Nonetheless I can just order and sit down to watch the hustle for awhile.

data.formatted_address: 6b Đường Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam

reviews.text: This is a lovely spot for strolling around the city. The flowers were in full bloom, making the area even more beautiful.
Lovely statue amid plants in the traffic circle near the flower market and night market

In Da Lat, it is one of the busiest markets. Vegetables, fruits, and other fresh goods sold by locals, there are flower shops presenting lovely hues at reasonable costs.

A lot of city dwellers travel here to shop in the morning and in the evening. However, it can seem a little less clean here.
you can find anything there. and you’ll pay at least twice less than anywhere else. strawberry in dalat is amazing btw
So many things to see here. I tried my first dried persimmon and roasted chestnut here, and taste good

A must-visit place when coming to DL

Surrounding Dalat Market -  The Art /The Trees/The River/The Temple . It's just lovely feeling
Come to Dalat especially on a Sunday(s). Feast awaiting not only for the eyes but for the tummy too. 👍😀
