data.formatted_address: Dinh I, Trần Quang Diệu, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Bao Dai Palace 1

reviews.text: Learned an important piece of Da Lat's history. An asset that is very well-kept, and the yard looked perfect. For tourists with young children like my family, having the stall selling slushies really helped to keep them happy 😊.  i think this Palace is a must-visit for any tourist here.

Interesting museum with informations available on English. It's relatively small manor but have excellent photo spots all over general area. Some areas (e.g. helicopter, smaller villas) need extra fee for entrance and photo.

Nice and beautiful palace. I love the way this to be organised and really clean inside. Be proud that VN has a city like Dalat, Vung Tau,  Danang, Hue etc. where still reserve all belonging to the King, the last dynasty that was mixed both VN and western Europe style…

Cool place to check out. The flowers and scenery was very beautiful and the helicopter pad in the back was cool.  Not a lot to do for kids and the flowers were fake. The staff was friendly and there was plenty of parking. They also had an option to get your picture on a horse or go for a ride. Not a bad place to check out, but also not on the top of my list of the best places to go to in Dalat, Vietnam.
A nice place to visit. I paid 90,000 vnd for 1 person, and got free flower tea. You can ride a horse if you want, but enjoying the beautiful surroundings with flowers is enough for me.

data.formatted_address: 57 Phan Bội Châu, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Maze Bar

reviews.text: We went during the day, so not many people around. We ordered Mojitos and they were nice. It was fun to go around and find all different ways to get to the top! You think you reach the top when you get to a terrace/balcony facing the street, but there’s more towards the back and big garden! We had a fun time and spent a bit more than an hour I think. It’s great you don’t have to pay entry fee, reason why we chose coming here vs the crazy house, which made no sense for us to visit.

If you’re in the mood for a funky experience, you should definitely visit Maze bar! It’s real fun to buy a drink when you enter and walk around the place. There is a lot to see and experience. However, if you have anxiety for small places I would not recommend this as there are also no emergency exit signs available throughout the place.

The Maze Bar was such a cool thing to do here in Da Lat. Totally unique. We have never seen anything like it.

When you enter you purchase a beverage and then the maze is free. The prices for beverages were not bad at all considering you are having an experience also.

We went in the afternoon because we did not want it to be too busy. We wanted to just be able to roam around slowly. The garden upstairs was really nice to sit and relax while soaking in the views of the city.

Not sure how long ago this was built.

This is definitely a cool place to see!

For more adventures in Da Lat follow us on YouTube @eyecool
Had a delectable time at Maze bar last night.  After many alcoholic beverages the stairs were tackled with extreme caution… wonder at your own risk. Great atmosphere and would recommend 💯

When you enter this amazing bar, you can really feel the love and effort that was put into building this place. So many little details and beautiful decorations with a different vibe on each floor, make this bar truly unique. The drinks are not exceptional but very cheap. It’s a must if you’re visiting Dalat!

data.formatted_address: 57 Phan Bội Châu, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: 100 Roof Bar

reviews.text: It is definitely one good experience. The staff has barely any passion in dealing with people but you tend to forget it once you’re in. The secret garden on the back was brilliant!

What a crazy bar, loved it!
The drinks a very good (got a whisky sour) and the Maze is super cool. So much to discover and if you think you know everything, there's more around the corner.
The blendet cookie drinks are also fantastic, my gf got one and I was pretty envy.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting an extraordinary cafe bar in Dalat, and it left me absolutely enchanted. This place seamlessly combines the whimsy of "Alice in Wonderland" with the surrealism of Salvador Dali and the architectural obscurity of Antoni Gaudi.

Walking through its doors feels like stepping into a fantastical realm, where every corner holds a delightful surprise. The interior design is an artistic masterpiece in itself, with curvaceous, dream-like structures and colorful mosaics that transport you into a different dimension.

While the drinks are slightly higher priced, it's well worth it for the immersive experience this place offers. The entry fee acts as a ticket to a world of wonder and creativity. Whether you're a lover of art, a fan of Dali, or simply seeking a unique and magical night out, this cafe bar in Dalat is an absolute must-see. It's an adventure you won't soon forget.

This place was such a wild fever dream I hardly remembered to take photos. We came here from a recommendation from a friend who had already traveled to Vietnam and said it was worth visiting. We were not disappointed. I would not say this is a place to expect great service as they serve hordes of tourists, but you aren’t going for that. You are going for the absolutely wild experience of what I could only imagine Alice in Wonderland felt when she went down the rabbit hole. It is unlikely you will get lost, but it may take you 15-20 minutes to get through to the top if you take your time and lean into the experience. For drinks, we get a double shot of the blended cookies and it gave us a good little buzz as we wandered around. If you are in Dalat and looking for something unique, come here.

A very unique bar… drinks were good and reasonably priced.

As the name says the building is made into a huge maze through multiple floors… twist, turns and crazy decorations and many places to sit and have a drink.

I gave this a 3 star because well it was a bit scary getting lost in the maze with no clear exit signs and all I could think was how hazardous this place is to be walking around drinking.

Very cool to check out but warning the maze is dark, cramp and a bit claustrophobic.

data.formatted_address: 80A Đường Mai Anh Đào, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: XQ Đà Lạt Sử Quán

reviews.text: Big premise. Unique exhibition center which vary style of art. However because of the premises have been extended, the organisation is not really good. It’s hard to find the way around and the walking path are like a maze, which is not only hardly get to where you want but also not easy to find the exit. They should put more detail about directions and have a detailed map. Hope they can  fix these issues in the future.

When entering the XQ da lat su quan, they told me not to take pictures in XQ da lat su quan, so I unfortunately couldn't take them. But When I looked up the review, other people took pictures, Is this right? Is it a different policy for each manager? I think it would be better for the XQ da lat su quan to allow take pictures in XQ da lat su quan, so don't make only good people stupid. The interior and exterior space are large.

A big area to display art embroider . All works done by hand . There are many things to see , to explore. They should take entrance fee , this money can be use for maintenance. I paid 98,000VND to entrance inside the building with a lot of display houses. It worth every cents. Highly recommend if you are in Dalat

Very surprising place, do not hesitate to take the tour as you'll discover plenty of things which are excluded from the free tour.

You'll learn the beauty of embroidery Art in this location where everything is made to stimulate artists creativity. Refreshing.

However, we were a bit disappointed by the tour guide who pushed us to visit quickly with very few explanation
Big museum building. Lots of embroidery, but also tradicional dresses, paintings and other objects. Spend at least 1 hour or more exploring. Some part free, some other part 100.000 ticket fee.

data.formatted_address: Điện thờ Phật Mẫu Đà Lạt, Tự Phước, Phường 11, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Cao Dai Temple of Da Lat

reviews.text:
Hidden gem! If you're into religious history and culture, you cannot miss this. This church belongs to a sect/religion combined of all religions in Vietnam - something definitely worth discovering.

After a short climb, you'll find this towering over the valley. The hilltop and church offer a history lesson, amazing artworks, spectacular views + a solid workout.

You can do it easily during the 30 min break if you take the vintage train ride. Much more worth seeing than the other pagoda.

The temple/cathedral(?) of Caodaism, a local Southern Vietnamese religion. A very interesting to visit and to see a different side of Vietnam. I was the only visitor when I was there. The temple/cathedral locates on a hill so it would be the best to drive a scooter.
A short drive from Dalat is worth the time to see this nice little settlement and temple. The artwork and decorations are quite exquisite in their detail.

Vietnam original religión, Cao Dai, the temple look like a church and temple mixed together and it's so colorful and bright. It is the mixture of Christianity and Buddhism, too. The followers in white gowns were praying there...
It is nice architecture. Colorful building on the top of hill. But they always closed. I could not get inside

data.formatted_address: Đường Ba Đình, TT. Nam Ban, Lâm Hà, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Linh Ẩn Pagoda

reviews.text:
A great experience and stunning view of elephant waterfall.

Peaceful and welcoming.  Pagoda is super impressive at 71 m high.

No tickets needed.

Very beautiful temple with a big peaceful statue of female buddha (Kwan Yuan).  It contain so many statues of kwan yuan and other buddha.  Very big temple, great place to take pictures, woship buddha and meditate.

Our plan was to see Thác Voi và chùa Linh Ẩn, or Elephant Falls and the Linh An pagoda, but unfortunately after a short walk from where the city bus lets you off, the gates to the waterfalls were closed. A sign read that they were closed until further announcement. We walked to the pagoda, and down from that level, you can walk and get a better view of the waterfall. The pagoda and surrounding grounds are quite lovely, serene and peaceful.

Such a beautiful temple. I really recommend visiting here when in Dalat. The surroundings are beautiful, you can see a waterfall next to the temple.

Free entry.
A most beautiful and tranquil place. I walked there in 15mins from my farmstay at 6.30am. Hardly any tourist around and enjoyed the energies

The class has the most dedicated instructor among the classes I've ever taken. Enthusiastic teachers teach students from the most basic steps. people like me who don't know how to draw. Through a course, I learned a lot of things. Thank you very much teacher

data.formatted_address: 75 Yersin, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: XQ Art House

reviews.text: A magnificent place where you can see the hard work of every hand made embroidery and skills in every artwork

Absolutely amazing! The art here is truly breathtaking and beautiful. Awe-inspiring masterpieces that really need to be seen to be believed. The level of detail is incredible. Some even look like photographs. These must have taken a VERY long time to make. ...quite simply - you HAVE to come here.

This is a must-see for anyone who comes to Dalat- or even Vietnam in general. Come here and you will be blown away by the beauty of this art. The rest of the house and its contents are very interesting, too. Higly recommended!
This should be a UNESCO world heritage site, in my personal opinion. This needs to be preserved for generations.
Unbelievably gorgeous. You'll never see anything like this anywhere else. I'm so happy with the 2 sided embroidery we bought. Lovely memories and joy knowing how it's all done.

Lovely staff (someone with english for other just google translate closed to you)the house is very complete with embroidery and paints.
Also you can see them working or buy a gift.
Recommended it!

Amazing embroidery. Some of the peices are quite large and very intricate. The house consists of 4 floors and a basement. It is worth a visit.
We were also offered a small cup of tea when we entered. If you are so inclined, there are prices on the works, ranging from 50$ - $100,000s USD.
I couldn't recommend this place more.

Side note, there are a number of Pidgeons outside because it seems the owner has built homes for them.

data.formatted_address: 258 Đường Mai Anh Đào, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Xq Da Lat Art House

reviews.text: I stumbled on the XQ Art House quite by accident as I was wondering around the super quaint city of Da Lat.  Decided to pay the museum fee and take a peek and oh WOW I am sure glad it did.  What an amazing place.  This is a museum of exquisite fine art like no other I have ever seen. It is filled to the brim with silk embroidery that is so insanely detailed that is is hard to believe they were all hand made. What a labor of love. Some of the art pieces stand 8 feet tall (2.5M) and must contain millions and millions of threads. So detailed that it looks like a high quality photo until you get closer and see the threads.  Shocking is all I can say.  I have a whole new appreciation and respect for the art of embroidery. Aside from the many art pieces, there is an interesting curation from start to finish that takes you on a journey of Vietnamese culture which I found very interesting. This is easily a 2 hour experience, more if you are an art lover as there is just so much to take in here.  I discovered their Saigon location too, which is a mini version of this place, but if you can make it to Da Lat, this is absolutely the epicenter of fine embroidery, perhaps in the whole world.

The most beautiful place! This is how a museum complex should be, a living and atmospheric space. Huge respect to those, the people who create and support this, to all the workers🙏🏻🙏🏻 One of the best places I have seen while visiting the 48th country

data.formatted_address: Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Governor's Palace

reviews.text:
An amazing history site, not only to the city, but to the memory of the nation in general.
The mansion was built in the early 20th century and to all the researcher surprised, there was no record of it.
I was lucky enough to have a look inside and was stunned by the architect, the mind and the heart put in to preserve the memory of Đà Lạt.
It pains me to know that they are going to "upgrade" the mansion by building a whole compound of hotel around the hill and there is no assurance that they will keep the interior design.
I actually got to study about this mansion at school as it is a part of heritage.
It was still on disputed therefore I understand why a while ago, some people can't get in.
Next to the mansion is one of the most crazy and fun coffee shop you'll ever be, "Way to the moon" coffee.
Highly highly recommend both places!

Unfortunately they close down the building so we can only look and take photos around the house. The place is not taken care of much, but I'm surprise to see a very beautiful scenery right next to the building

Was there late in the day, place closed, haunted mansion vibes.
Pleasant green space in the heart of the bustling city
nice point to visit if you’re walking around the city! it’s absolutely free
A very interesting place to explore with beautiful architecture (a little bit scary)

data.formatted_address: Trần Quang Diệu, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Phường 10, Đăk Nông, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Du lịch Đà Lạt

reviews.text: Ok
The sound museum is being completed. Where you can explore the land of melodies. Learn more about Dak Nong Geopark.

Home to the only Earth Sound Center in Vietnam. Here you will feel the sounds of the earth with the theme of the planets: METAL, WOOD, WATER, FIRE. Accordingly, you will feel the sounds of rocks, wind, water, wood and our own sounds.

The sound museum tour was really interesting. To hear and experience the sounds of wind, water, fire, rocks, our own
... evoke and stimulate the curiosity of visitors here. In addition, the formation of the Geopark will be a development lever for Dak Nong and Gia Nghia town to develop day by day.

The center is in an inconvenient location for community activities, the roads are not complete even though it is located on a hill with quite a beautiful view. The campus is spacious but bare and lacks trees, and the building is in a degraded state. Because this province has not yet established a museum or library, these institutions are probably being temporarily integrated into this center. Their collection is as "poor" as its temporary situation.

data.formatted_address: 2 Đ. Trần Phú, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66100, Vietnam
data.name: Khách sạn Dalat Palace

reviews.text: Indulged in a wonderful stay at a hotel that immerses you in nostalgia. Despite the slightly worn decor, it evokes the essence of French colonial charm. The spacious rooms offered a comfortable retreat. While the breakfast and high tea spreads were decent, the standout was the exceptional hospitality of the service staff. The hotel's proximity to the night market added to its appeal, and the picturesque view of the lake adorned with beautiful flowers was truly enchanting. Plus, enjoy a luxurious airport transfer in the Mercedes E-Class.Just a heads-up, there are no elevators, so be ready for some stair-climbing during your stay.

This was my first trip to this fine property and quite honestly, I could not imagine going to DaLat and staying anywhere else. The service was excellent, the room and the view was perfect, and the bar fixed just a wonderful Gin and Tonic. While sitting out on the expansive veranda during a soft summer rain that blew in, I felt transported back in time. I remarked to my fiance that I felt like I was in a Graham Greene novel. Just sitting there enjoying my G and T made the long trip to Vietnam worthwhile. We took advantage of the breakfast in the morning and the high tea in the evening. Everything about the hotel was just perfect. The room was great, the view was stellar, and food was wonderful. The manager, the assistant manager, and the front desk staff were all so nice and professional. The bellman were great as well. I can not thing of a single negative thing about this grand old hotel.. My only regret was that we only stayed for a couple of nights. When I return to DaLat you can be assured that I will staying at the Palace Hotel with all of its charm and elegance.

I enjoyed every day I stayed.
The room condition was excellent, especially the bed and pillows were very clean and nice.
The front desk staff also spoke English well, so there was no inconvenience in communication at all, and thanks to the antique building and friendly staff, I had a nice stay.
If you are looking for accommodation in Dalat, I highly recommend it.

I went for afternoon tea. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were very polite and helpful. However the afternoon tea was not very good as the sandwiches seemed stale and the cakes tasteless. It would also be great if they could label the food with allergens. Maybe instead of doing a buffet, they could do a more traditional afternoon tea so they don’t have the food sitting out so much.
The experience was nice but the food disappointing.

We only had afternoon tea and looked around. Hotel is certainly showing its age and needs renovation from when I last visited in the 2000s (back when it was managed by Sofitel). But it's still great for afternoon cake. I did not stay here, so no comments from me about room quality.

data.formatted_address: VCXX+4H, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Datanla Waterfall

reviews.text: Ride an alpine coaster to and from a beautiful waterfall and creek. There are great places to meander and get great photos. Also there are places to drink and snack both at the beginning and at the waterfall.

Entry for ð50k/£1.60/US$2. Really fun alpine coaster for ð140k/£4.50/US$5.60. The views from the second waterfall are worth the walk, but if you haven’t bought a ticket for Alpine Coaster 3, you will have to walk back up.

After getting off the car at the end of the track, you can see the waterfall. Although it is not large in scale, it has plenty of water and is suitable for taking photos. By the way, this is the first time I have seen waterfalls in the five years since I arrived in Vietnam. It is rare to see mountains in South Vietnam despite the vast plains. It is said that you can also engage in river tracing and rock climbing activities here. On the same day, I met a foreigner doing rappelling activities on the upper edge of the waterfall.

I was a bit reluctant because of the distance and roller coaster cost. At the end, I'm glad I came. I asked for taxi which cost 300k return trip which is super expensive.

Share a tips.  Called a grab car and it only cost 77k.  When you are picked up, ask the driver for another service coming back to city center.  Our driver even drives us to tuyen lam lake, to dinner with a little bit fee of 100k.  So worth it.

The roller coaster has brakes, so no worry about the speed. There are few turns which are exciting and scary, but do follow the rules, don't wear loose hat as we see lots of hats down at the alpine hills below.   Don't use selfie sticks or holding a camera. I carry a GoPro wrist band so it's ok.

I will not share the ride to let you guys explore.  I'm not spoiler type of person

At the bottom is waterfall with few picture perfect spots.  30 minutes is enough down there.

You probably need 1 and a half hour for the trip.  When you left don't forget to buy the picture of you while in the coaster.  It is cheap. No slaughtering.

There was a bit of a queue for the rollercoaster to get to the falls. It wasn't too bad in the middle of December. When I came back up I also rode the zipwire back down to the falls again.  The falls themselves were quite beautiful.

data.formatted_address: Unnamed Road Tp, WGXX+P5G, Xuân Thọ, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Tiger Cave

reviews.text:
Da Lat's Tiger Cave, well, it wasn't quite what I pictured. Don't get me wrong, the place is beautiful. Lush pine forests everywhere, the air crisp and clean, and the sound of the waterfall rushing through the rocks was incredibly calming. But managing expectations is key.

The trek to the cave itself is a bit more work than some reviews let on. It's not a paved walk in the park. Think more uneven paths, tree roots underfoot, and maybe some light mosquito action. Wear proper shoes – this isn't flip-flop territory.

The cave itself is pretty underwhelming. More of a small grotto than a spelunking adventure.  If you're looking for Indiana Jones vibes, you won't find them here. But hey, it is a nice little spot to cool off after the walk and maybe snap a photo.

The waterfall, however, is the real star. It's not massive, but powerful enough to create a refreshing mist and a cool pool at the base. Perfect for dipping your toes in to escape the midday heat.

All in all, Tiger Cave is a lovely half-day trip from Da Lat if you're up for a scenic walk and a refreshing waterfall dip. Just be prepared for a slightly more rustic experience than some of the brochures might have you believe.

Right now it is the rain season and the road is really destroyed. It is written everywhere on the way that the waterfall is closed but we still managed to get there.
We went there with a motorcycle and we had quite a hard time because the road was really slippery. When we arrived near the waterfall it was closed with some plastic tarps but we asked the people working there and they let us in. The view is nice and we were alone. But this place is hard to get to because of the bad weather and the destroyed roads.
It's not open yet. But they make renovation there. Road is very bed so if U are not good driver, better waiting until it's would be officially opened. But this waterfall is amazing.

The sign said you can not go but tourists seem to not care. The way down and up are a little treacherous. A lot of trash, which is a little disappointing. The waterfall itself is beautiful and is not flooded with tourists.

Fantastic place with one major con, which is typical for entire Vietnam; it is dirty, full of plastic waste!!! I really can't understand why they do this to their own land... 😖
We got there with rented motorbike which was bit challenging at the end but doable. Place is supposed to be closed, but you can Enter without any hindering. There are signs warning of danger, but i haven't seen any. Through i guess during the wet Season it might be pretty dangerous.
All in all worth playing a visit.
I give four stars only because of the plastic waste

data.formatted_address: Than Tho Lake, Phường 12, Dalat, Lam Dong, Vietnam
data.name: Than Tho Lake

reviews.text: under the re-surface the facility, but too much glass houses surrounding.This place Used to be a quiet places, you could hear the nice sound of the wind only, whistled through the Pine forest. Totally disappointed.

The pictures online make it look this super serene, mystical place. Tranquil water reflecting the pine trees, you know, the whole deal.  Reality?  Well, it's definitely a lake, and there are pine trees around, but the whole area feels a little neglected.  There's a kind of melancholic vibe, but not necessarily in a good way.  It's more like...abandoned picnic spot?

Don't get me wrong, it has a certain charm.  The water is still and quiet, and it's interesting to hear the legends about why it's called the Lake of Sighs.  But if you're looking for a stunning natural beauty spot, there are probably better options around Da Lat.  Unless, of course, you're specifically drawn to that slightly sad, forgotten atmosphere.  Then, Than Tho Lake might be your cup of tea.

It's closed all the times I visit it. So disappointed.

There are tall wall outside. So there is no possible way to take photos without getting inside.
That messed up my experience. Unfortunately there is nothing i can do.
That is what happens so often whenever the evil capitalists take over a tourist attraction.
Everything is ruined.
The lake has been drained for farming and is now a construction site.
Beautiful

data.formatted_address: Quang Trung, Phường 9, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Railway Station

reviews.text: French styled station, not in use for passenger services but short tourist rides can be taken. Lovely old buildings and gardens. A token fee to enter, 5000 dong, worth the payment if your in the area. A couple of good cafes here, not overpriced and serving good coffee.

I recommend taking the ride, not for the destination but for the journey. Show up 50 min before and buy the tickets, I was sitting in the first class but it does not really matter. It's great and the views are cool too. They let you open the door and look out too, which is nice.

As always, if you speak Vietnamese it will help a lot. If you don't, just show up earlier to make sure you get the ticket for the time you want.

I'm adding the timeable.

I also recommend using the 30 min to explore the caodaist hilltop temple and not the pagoda.

They start selling tickets only 50 minutes prior to travel now.
I came first and I never got vip1 tickets, because they sell tickets out of line to some groups. Be careful, there is a chance you don't get vip1 in any way. That's disgusting.
With such an attitude I would've never come here.

Exploring Linh Phuoc Pagoda by Train
Upon arrival, there's an admission fee of 5,000 dong. For first-class round-trip train tickets, the cost is an additional 148,000 dong per person. The train ride takes about 25 minutes each way, followed by a 40-minute visit to the Linh Phuoc Pagoda.
It seemed to us that this time was not enough; we returned to this pagoda another day. But if you're in a hurry, you can kill two birds with one stone. We drove at sunset and the views were beautiful. The only thing that marred our trip were the hundreds of Chinese tourists, they were everywhere.

Nice place to visit and it’s better if you don’t encounter bigs group of tourists. If you don’t take the train, you can enjoy the coffee at the coffee shop. There are two sites for restrooms but one of them is not functioning. Need more care from the operator, especially when it’s crowded.

No A/C, only an electronic fan was  provided. No safe to store stuff. Average room size with antique looking furnitures...

Beautiful hotel beside general Government administration services center. Friendly people at both services center and Sammy hotel staff. Wonderful natural fresh air with comfortable temperature. Nice flowers bloom everywhere.

data.formatted_address: WCRP+MQW, Đường Nguyễn Thị Minh Khai, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Festival Town

reviews.text:
Langfarm Tourist Area - Dalat's Tranquil Retreat

Let me take you on a journey to the enchanting Langfarm Tourist Area in Dalat. Here's your story-driven guide:

Nature's Embrace: Discover the serenity of lush landscapes, serene lakes, and blooming flower gardens. Perfect for nature lovers and photographers.

Eco-Adventures: Engage in outdoor activities like hiking, birdwatching, and pedal boating. It's a haven for adventure enthusiasts.

Culinary Delights: Savor Dalat's renowned cuisine at on-site restaurants. Don't miss the fresh produce and local specialties.

Relaxing Stays: Choose from charming homestays and cozy lodges. Wake up to misty mornings and breathtaking views.

Local Treasures: Support local artisans by exploring craft shops for unique souvenirs.

Langfarm offers an escape into Dalat's tranquility, where the wonders of nature and local culture await. Embrace the journey and let the stories of this picturesque retreat unfold.
This Festival Town hasn't finished yet in March, 2021 but the decor is promising.

A space located inside Dalat's night street
Ticket price: free
On one side is L'ang Farm with a Japanese-style village gate
On one side is the living and performance area for tourists.
I always see very trendy music playing. Sit back and relax after shopping or eating at Da Lat Night Market

The new fair area was built on Nguyen Thi Minh Khai Night Market Street, Da Lat
Inside there are photo areas and kiosks selling snacks.
Decorated in a very colorful and sparkling manner.
Young people can have colorful pictures of the city of flowers.
Open free to everyone.
Everyone can take commemorative photos and buy Lang Farm products.

data.formatted_address: WFV4+8Q8, Phường 10, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Da Lat–Thap Cham railway

reviews.text:
It's funny......
but.....
not romantic, no beautiful landscape,
If you are not an absolute railway freak, you should leave it.
Beautiful Dalat train station. Entrance fee of 5000 Dong. Worth visiting.

data.formatted_address: WCFV+5HC Đồi Robin, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66116, Vietnam
data.name: Da Lat Cable Car Station

reviews.text:
We went there on foot from the Da Lat bus station.  It was just a 5-10-minute walk but there is no side walks.

The cable car station is clean and the staff there is really friendly.  Though not fluent in English, the lady at the ticket counter kindly suggested that we should be aware of the staff lunch time (11:30-13:00) when the cable cars stop.

The view from the cable car was also beautiful.  Mountains far away, Da Lat city over the hills, people's lives just below.  The ride was a perfect getaway from the busy life in the city area.

Pagoda on top of the mountain is also beautiful surrounded with flowers and nicely mended trees.  There seems the meditation rooms and would like to try it someday.

Good to go if you have spare time in Da Lat, but I wouldn’t recommend it otherwise. You can buy tickets when you arrive or online via Klook (same price). It wasn’t crowded when we arrived, so it was pretty quick. Scooter parking was around 3K, and cable car 150K return trip. There is a temple and a lake at the other side of the cable car that you can explore.
Nice smooth ride, lovely scenery. We could not access the lake the lane was blocked, that was a shame. Monastery and glass gardens worth a view.

The cable ride itself was fantastic and worth the cost, but the end point was s little underwhelming in terms of the monastery and lake. The staff were very helpful and didn't quibble when we asked for a cable car for just the two of us ie not to share. The ride shuts for 1 hour 12.00 till 13.00 we turned up at 13.10 a very busy time that is advisable to avoid. Tickets can only be bought by cash and some times the queue stalls if a coach operator is buying tickets.

It is a must to experience when traveling to Da Lat. You can purchase the ticket on the spot or through Klook.

The cable car is not very large and may only accommodate up to 4 people.

data.formatted_address: 90B Vạn Thành, Phường 5, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 670000, Vietnam
data.name: Khu du lịch Fresh Garden Dalat

reviews.text: Beautiful gardens, sculptures and artwork. We spent 3 hours walking around and taking photos. There were very few people on a weekday afternoon. An adult ticket is 120,000 VND. Highly recommended!

Please don’t waste your time and money. Tickets are 120k/person. Don’t get me wrong, the photos for this place look stunning, which is why I wanted to go so bad.

Realistically, it’s a terribly maintained, abandoned looking area. Everything is dirty, there’s not much colour, and it’s just a pure disappointment. Especially for the price, it is not worth it at all.

If you want to go here to take some pictures in a few very specific spots and angles, then spend time editing them to make it look a lot more beautiful and vibrant then it actually was, go ahead. Just be prepared for disappointment.

Please visit during times when it is not crowded. Group tours will destroy the peace. Older Vietnamese group tourists don't stand in line and take their pictures. Originally, Vietnam was like that. Please understand for a pleasant trip

I do recommend to visit this Garden! Incredibly nice place to enjoy nature and flowers and stunning scenery. It is not that big, but worth visiting. You can  buy ticket on klook service for hassle free experience or buy right there at counter. It's high in the mountains so you may freeze out a bit, so wear some warm coat. They decorated gardens so well there. Feels so refreshing walking along the lake, you even can see the real forest nearby. Great place to enjoy views and fresh air.
It's a really amazing place, all the flowers and like a magic ❤️ Ticket price is 80.000VND but only with cash. All places you need to take cash with you in Dalat. You can find a ticket at Klook.

data.formatted_address: 02 Đ. Trần Nhân Tông, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Vườn hoa thành phố Đà Lạt

reviews.text: For the price and amount of area you could walk, I guess you could say it was a good value. Some of the flowers and plants were nice but most were still in pots and not properly planted. A lot of the statues and artwork were questionable. Clearly effort was put into making them, but not maintaining. Water was also not very well taken care of, some stenches near the back of the park. I am glad I was able to go here, but I would not recommend taking children here. Even the children oriented areas were a little bit disturbing with age. There were also some animals, like fish and a horse. The captivity of both was quite concerning. The horse was chained to a stationary carriage and was thrashing around, clearly in pain, and a worker nearby was not attentive at all. The fish tank also looked like it hadn’t been maintained in a long time, but at least the fish were alive(?)

The girls enjoyed this place and I must admit there were some very nice foliage in the Japanese section. It's 100.000 vnd per person to enter and I think that is a little bit High however it was well a well-maintained area. Watch out for the guy who takes your tickets he puts one in let's all three of you through and keeps the other two tickets for himself, it is a scam!

You don't need to pay 100,000 donc  for admission fee for a person to the DALAT Flower Park. Planted flowers are so and so, it stinks very horrible from two ponds where the water there went bad because of unrefined drainage.

Overall thought this garden was... Decent... Nothing particularly good about it beyond a smaller bonsai section all the way in the back. Throughout the initial garden some standard flowerbeds are littered with some concerning statues, which make the whole experience very strange.

The intention was good, but this is a place that looks better on the pictures than in real life. This suffers from a problem that's all over Vietnam and some other Asian countries as well. The problem is: lack of maintenance.

All the statues and decorations were probably beautiful when they were built, but it seems that they just let it age. No repaint, no removing of mold and dirt. The water pond is full of trash. It's so sad to see. It could be a really beautiful place!

I give it three stars because I see the park's potential.

You should also lover the price so that the locals can afford it. I'm sorry to say it but now it just feels like a tourist trap.

data.formatted_address: Xã, Xuân Thọ, Tp. Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Garden hydrangeas

reviews.text:
Cute place to visit, but not many things to do there, there are a dozen art installations inside the hydrangea garden, where you can take nice pictures and videos, and there is also a bridge, almost like in ba na hills. The house on the side was closed for reconstruction and the area near it was a desert.
The entrance is 100k, and the ticket includes one drink from the cafe inside, you can pick coffee, tea or juice. Moto parking is about 5k near to the entrance.

It is underrated and people should cone here instead of other place.
The entrace fee include a free drink.
There is a mini famous god hand bana hills
The place is not crowded so you can take many picture as you want
Wishing the management can take care of the garden and flower more

Went right after they opened, very few people in the flower areas and the cafe. It was lovely in the right lighting and the flowers were huge!

After trying both the coffees and teas, my preference is definitely for the teas. Try the rice milk tea! The VND 100k entrance fees come with any drink on the menu.

I went here because I wanted to see imitation of golden bridge at Ba Na Hills. If you want to be alone at this bridge or you are keen on flowers, it is worth to visit, otherwise I would not recommend it. The price is quite high 100.000 VND but you have one drink for free (drink usually cost 50.000 VND).

Visited here after Cau Dat cloudy experience, and it complemented very well. The entrance fee is very affordable, and they included drinks. Garden is very well-kept. Cafe is great with selection of drinks from coffee,  tea, juices, besides bottled drinks.

data.formatted_address: Số 1 đường Hoa Hoàng Anh, khu du lịch Hồ Tuyền Lâm, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Lavender Dalat Tourist Area

reviews.text: Very calming and serene landscape. The cafe is on the pricey side but the view is stunning which makes it worthy. If you love flowers, you will love this place.

This was worth a visit. Pretty and a nice drive. There was nobody around. The food wasn't great but the drinks were nice.
Quality building still going on. Will be amazing once finished.

The view is spectacular, the environment very relaxing, but the drinks are awful and there's no food worthy of mentioning. Maybe one should bring their own food stuff. And very very costly. Please learn to make proper beverages.

Unfortunately the garden is still (March 2024) a construction site. Not much to see. I have no idea how they charge for this. I can see how this will be a nice garden i a couple of years. Not worth the visit now.

Amazing views with amazing service and drinks menu! We pop there out of curiosity whilst in Dalat and it was the best choice we made, they'd just reopened a few days ago so we had free coffee and 30% off other drinks (reopening offers). The views were great and they're clearly still doing some work to the place surrounding the cafe which if it turns out the same as the cafe itself then it will be great! Definitely recommend for a little drinks break as part of a day trip.

data.formatted_address: Đường Đá Quý, Đá Quý, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Phoenix Garden Dalat Hill

reviews.text:
Gorgeous coffee space, everyone. Morning or evening, there is a view to admire and chill. Milk tea and coffee are both fragrant, reasonably priced compared to the area there, perfect to check in and enjoy. Especially this shop is located on the way to the land bridge to hunt clouds, so it is very convenient for people to come back from hunting and then stop in for a drink. In addition, the store also has a brand new HomeStay area. The rooms are extremely spacious, new and clean. I have a clip below. One room can accommodate 6-8 people. Here, it only takes 20 minutes to go to Da Lat City, but only 30 minutes to go cloud hunting. Convenient both ways. If you need coffee to check in in the morning, you don't have to go far. Everyone, remember to book early to enjoy.

Extremely pleased to find this hidden gem. This coffee shop has great both Milk Tea and Coffee with decent price compared to other coffee shops in the area. The best thing about this shop is the view. You can find amazing scenery both day and night. It lies 20 mins from the city center and 30 minutes from Dat Bridge where you stand above the clouds. Super convenient. You can also book Homestay with this place for newly built rooms and brand new amenities. Highly recommend reaching out and book for your next stay. I LOVED my stay here.
wonderful. A place to let your soul dream. Always stop by every time I come to Dallas
Beautiful scenery, delicious drinks, polite staff
Nature
Extreme view 🤩

data.formatted_address: 49 Đường Hà Huy Tập, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66000, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Skyline Hotel

reviews.text: Ok
Ks but affordable price. The room is clean and fragrant. Enthusiastic support! Stay overnight and clean the room daily! Next time I will come again 🥰🥰 10 VND

This is my second stay at this hotel. I find the service good and the owners are also very enthusiastic
The room is clean and has hot and cold water, especially with a fan for 10 VND
Location near the center is convenient to go anywhere

Located near the chicken church, around the restaurant is full of dishes. The hotel does not have enough blankets/blanket so please ask for more for your baby to cover. There is a parking garage, but it only has enough space for 3 cars. It's inconvenient to park in front of the hotel and the police pick it up

The hotel location is easy to find, near the interprovincial bus station and Xuan Huong Lake, the receptionist is cheerful. Rooms are clean, good soundproofing. Spacious parking
Very comfortable when booking here. I booked a room through the app and the price was 247k, so it was ok.

data.formatted_address: 20 Đ. Nguyễn Chí Thanh, Phường 1, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66110, Vietnam
data.name: Khách Sạn Đà Lạt View

reviews.text: Awful room, OK service, only good thing is the near-center location

Old room, no drinking water, dirty toilet
Fraudsters promise good service but do not deliver and still collect money.
The hotel is ok, right in the center, always cheap and clean, the staff are very nice and friendly.
The hotel lied, never coming back
Near Da Lat Night Market, convenient to move.

data.formatted_address: 224/1 Yersin, Phường 9, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Dalat Adventure Tours

reviews.text: Today we went canyoning in Da Lat with Dalat Adventure Tours. So far the best experience we had in Vietnam!! The tour guides are incredible, they are great in English, really funny, helpful and very good in explaning how and what to do. And not to forget... they are handsome (inside joke). We highly recommend this tour with these guys, what an epic day!! Thank you very, very much!!

We just came back from our best experience in Vietnam as of yet! Our handsome tourguides were funny, helpful and kind! The tour includes a variety of activities as you move along the waterfall such as sliding, swimming, hiking, climbing. All while having beautiful jungle surroundings. Keep in mind that you need to be fit and not be afraid of heights, the currents and waterfalls are quite strong while climbing down the steep rocks(25m was the highest). Thank you for this amazing trip, we'll never forget it!

This was one of the best activities I've done on my travels. The small group limit is a real strength as it means you're never sat waiting around too long. The guides, Nila and Long, are incredible - great English, funny, really helpful, and calm. Your safety is very important to them. They even gave us recommendations on the best food in Dalat! The activity itself is super exciting - there's a bit of trekking between the waterfalls, and the scenery is stunning. We did 4 descents plus a practice run.

Wow! My husband and I booked the day before. We liked that it was small groups and starting early in the morning (7:50) and to our surprise it was just the two of us for our tour! Long and Naly were our guides and they were absolutely the best. I’d recommend asking for them when you do this experience. I was SUPER nervous (never done canyoning before) but they were fantastic in staying calm and encouraging both of us down the waterfalls. They explain each waterfall before you go down and there’s lots of support from both of them on the way down. Bonus- they took pictures and videos from the top and the bottom. We also got to eat at a really delicious local place for lunch and learn more about Long and Naly. Very genuine, patient and funny guides that love what they do. 100/10 recommend!!

Had an amazing time on the canyoning tour! Our guides KD and Long made the whole experience a lot of fun with their great personalities, photography skills and knowledge about the area. They do the tour with only small groups to allow a lot more time for activities (we got extra lucky as no one else had booked in so we got a private tour experience!) Very glad we decided to do this tour over the other options and would highly recommend it!! Cheers guys :)

data.formatted_address: 109 Nguyễn Văn Trỗi, Phường 2, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Pine Track Adventures

reviews.text: I didn't do a tour with them but I rented a mountainbike for 300k per day with helmet and lock (return at 6pm latest). The bike was fantastic, solid brand, perfect condition. They even prepared & greased it for me. Easy communication in English. Dalat area is really nice for Mountainbiking, and you can also just cruise around on your own, without needing a group. But you do need a good bike, since it's a lot of up and down. Their bikes are perfect for that :)

The team from Pine Track were phenomenally warm and showed us the best day on our Canyon Tour.

We were lucky enough to be in a smaller tour group which we preferred as this meant the team could focus on our personal safety and practice session,  as well as working with some of our group when fears began to arise. We also spent less tim waiting our turn at each obstacle.

They fetched us promptly, were very professional and safety conscious and lunch was delicious to boot with the team catering to my wife's vegetarianism as well.

We spoke to the guys from Pine Track Adventures on what's app and got an idea of when things are running and what could work for us.

We ended up doing a day of canyoning and a day of white water rafting which was incredible.

We planned to do a day of MTB riding but the rain made the trails too muddy.

The canyoning was awesome, really gets your heart pumping!

White water rafting was so much fun going through the rapids while our guide Lion helped us navigate through the river and made sure things were safe.

The lunches that are included in these tours are amazing ! Very fresh and local taste.

Would recommend going on yours with these guys to anyone. Dinh at the office was great when we went and spoke to him in person before we booked the tours.
Fantastic white water rafting adventure with Lion & Buffalo of Pine Track Adventure. They took great care of us and showed us the beauty of Da Lat from white water rafting along the Da Don River.

Just did the hiking and kayaking tour with Pine Track. It was excellent. Our guide, Dong, was a great guy and kept a good pace on the hike. The kayaking was easy and the lake was very picturesque … a very chilled time.
He also prepared a good lunch and was very knowledgeable about the area and Vietnam in general … a very nice person to have on the trip with us.
I’d recommend the trip. It’s not difficult hiking but you need a bit of fitness … there are some pretty steep bits but there’s no scrambling.

data.formatted_address: W8, KQH Đường Phù Đổng Thiên Vương, Phường 8, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 67000, Vietnam
data.name: Highland Sport Travel - Adventure Tours Dalat, Viet Nam

reviews.text: Paddle boarding around the lake was a highly enjoyable experience, greatly enhanced by our guide, Hugo. Despite English not being his first language, Hugo communicated effectively, making everyone feel at ease. The calm lake waters provided a perfect setting for both beginners and seasoned paddlers. The activity proved to be a great workout without feeling strenuous, and the social aspect made it even more fun. Overall, Hugo's knowledge and friendly demeanor made the adventure memorable and delightful. Love it 😻

Went solo, but my tour group was amazing! We had 3 wonderful tour guides Vincent, Hugo, and Seven who made sure we all had a great time! "Don't be lazy, get crazy!!!" I enjoyed my Dalat adventure very much! They also take superb photos of us during the adventure. With a souvenir laminated photo in the end. Lunch provided was also very satisfying!  My heart and belly are full 😁😂

Highly recommend everyone to join Highland’s Sup boat tour.
Especially, thanks to Mr Luc - my personal tour guide. He provided to me a lot of useful information about technical, nature, and travel tips.
If you have more time, you can take part in more activities at Highlands Sport like trekking, zip line, camping,…

Amazing views and accommodations, blankets were extremely warm to keep us warm during the night. Toilets were clean and there was also warm water. Amazing food and drinks ( u can ask for limitless extra portion until ur stuffed). Staffs are super helpful and enthusiastic. Massive appreciation for Mr.Luc and Mr.Hau for being the best staffs.

The canyoning experience with Seven, Kay, and Justin was truly exceptional. Their dedication and care made the adventure unforgettable. Haven‘t met such motivated and caring Tourguides in a really long time. They definitely love what they are doing. I felt safe the whole time even though you do the actual climbing alone they always let you know that they are there for you. The pictures they take the whole time from you (for free) is just a bonus. I would 100 % recommend booking the canyoning tour with them my experience couldn’t have been better. Thank you so much again it was an amazing day!! The pictures speak for themselves.

data.formatted_address: Đèo Prenn, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: High Rope Course & Zipline ( 1000m )

reviews.text: After doing the 1000m zipline and high ropes course, the experience was great. If you want to overcome your fear of heights, this place won't let you down. Before doing the high ropes course, I thought I would only make it to the red circuit at most because it looked really high up. But in the end, I actually completed the black circuit which was really satisfying! 👍 The instructors were great and gave me a lot of encouragement.
Easy experience. Just zipline throughout the forest. Not really challenging. It is ok for beginners.

A must visit if you have love for adventure and are keen to perform activities of rope climbing, zip lines and walking around the obstacles. This is the place. Has 6 levels and keeps getting difficult as you move up the levels. All in all a great fun if you go with family and friends.

Not sure why the low grades, this was excellent.

I did the High Rope Course, it was extremely fun and a fair arm workout, too. Definitely worth the money. I went on a weekday at midday and the place wasn't busy at all.

The course consists of six routes of increasing difficulty. After picking up the safety equipment at the entrance, you get a crash course on how to use the equipment and do a short trial run.

After the intro course, the staff will mark your start time and you'll have 2h from that point to complete the whole course.

The staff were super friendly and attentive, made sure that everyone was safe. They will come get you down if you decide to stop at any point.

This was my first time doing a rope course, I thought it might be awkward to show up alone, but it really doesn't matter cause you're doing the routes by your lonesome, anyway. I managed to complete the whole course with maybe 15 minutes to spare.

(I lucked out and barely ever had to wait for other people to move ahead with the course. It might be frustrating if you're fast and there's a group of people in front of you because you'd waste a lot of time just waiting around.)

You have to be fairly comfortable with heights since you'll be up in the trees the whole time.

They accept card payment. You can also get a ticket online through Klook, though I don't think it's necessary. Lockers are available at the entrance. They also have shoes you can borrow if your footwear isn't appropriate for the course.

I didn't do the Zipline because it's a bit overpriced. The Rope Course contains a dozen smaller ziplines so I didn't feel like I was missing out at all.

Me and my boyfriend had a fantastic time , you get plenty of time to do all the courses if you wish (I got as far as red and was very proud of myself!). It’s extremely safe compared to other high ropes course I’ve done before, and they are very patient at the start when they are going through safety instructions. There is always a guide following you along if you get stuck, and they are very helpful. Would highly recommend if you’re in Dalat!

data.formatted_address: B15 Đường Nguyễn Trung Trực, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 66000, Vietnam
data.name: Highland Adventure Travel Da Lat Canyoning Tour

reviews.text: We had the BEST day ever!! The tour is so fun, lots of good opportunities to go through various waterfalls, the zip line, and even a water slide. The best part is the amazing guides we had: Ya and Jack! They were very detailed in preparing us for what is happening at each obstacle. Extremely friendly talking to them as we walked through the forest. They took many pictures and videos as well to capture the moment.  Overall I can’t recommend them enough!!! If you are coming to Dalat this is a MUST DO activity!

Heard so much about the Canyoning Tour from others and was able to book through my hostel with the tour led by the amazing Tony & Broy! Not only did they give us some history about the area, they explained everything we were about to do in great detail. They supplied all the goods needed (even socks, shoes, water and midday snacks). They never rushed us, cracked some jokes and had great english so we understood everything that was said. Plus they even provided a home cook meal at the end of the day. Could not recommend this enough and something I would have never done anywhere else. 10/10

I did the double tour with the alpine rollercoaster and afterwards I went canyoning (while being afraid of heights, I know ^^) with them at Datanla waterfall. Felt safe the entire time and lots of fun. Tony and Jack were great guides and photographers ^^

I would recommend everyone to go with them! Especially if you don’t have a lot of time in Da Lat you should take the double tour.

(Also the food we got after the adventure was amazing and gave us strength back!)

FABULOUS DAY OUT!

We had a fantastic time Highland Adventure Travel are very professional and caring. We felt in safe hands with Na and Jack who were excellent safe and fun instructors.

The facilities regarding bag storage, showers and changing rooms were perfect! Not to forget the amazing lunch that was put on for us after our day out back at their head office.

To top it off they printed off a picture for us all and laminated it how sweet!

Bloody loved this tour. We had Ya, Jack and Dala as our tour guides and it was an amazing experience on its own but these guys made it twice as fun. Was such a laugh and a good time, couldn’t recommend a tour in the whole of Vietnam more!

data.formatted_address: WC3X+52M, Phường 3, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng, Vietnam
data.name: Datanla New Alpine Coaster

reviews.text:
Arrived here at around 1pm after visiting the viewpoint on the lake and the cable car across.

The alpine coaster fit 2 people in (250 000 each) and was sooo much fun! Wished that we could do it all over again!

The ticket included a fun trip down to the bottom of Datanla waterfall where you were able to get off, walk around and take some photos.

The tickets then also included a shorter ride back up to the start where you got on.

At the top there was combination packages for if you wanted to do the zipline as well.

By the time we left at 2:30pm it seemed to be getting a little busier.

Arrived at 7.30am on the weekday, board the coaster almost instantly. It was a thrilling ride until I caught up with the person before me who seems to love playing with the brake.

Waterfall was meh although the dinosaur‘s testicle pretty interesting.
Very cool experience and very safe (Swiss built) 250k entry fee the long alpine coaster takes you down the hill to the waterfall. Remember to keep your ticket as you need it for the return journey.

they have newest track that is longer than the track i visited (also cost more). the employees are very helpful, except when redeeming my voucher (booked it on traveloka) she was so slow. overall my experience was joyful.

Good adventure for one time. Interesting alpine coaster route, but too much short for this price.
Waterfall good but not the best.
A lot of tourists,  sometimes too much crowded

data.formatted_address: 11/11 Ngô Quyền, Phường 6, Thành phố Đà Lạt, Lâm Đồng 67000, Vietnam
data.name: Da Lat Canyoning - Viet Action Tours

reviews.text:
The canyoning tour was a great experience! Roy and D took us down lots of waterfalls, we also did natural water slides and ziplining. You leave at 8am and finish around 1pm, with lunch provided afterwards.

It is reasonably expensive at $70 but I can now say it's worth it. If youve got time you can do some of the abseils multiple times, which really made it feel like the price was worth it. Great tour guides & great fun!

This will be a review for our experience with the Canyoning tour.

Had the best and most exiting trip, rappelling down 25 meter waterfalls, floating down lazy rivers, getting sent head first down natural waterfalls and zip lines.

Truly believe our experience would not be the same with anyone else. The instructions were clear and easy. Made for basically everyone.

Recommend having some swimminwear with you to have underneath the wetsuit you get. Also wear some hikingshoes or something with grip that you don’t care to much about. WITH SOCKS UNDERNEATH. One of the waterfalls is socks only and borrowing socks ain’t the best.

You can’t bring your phone with you u less you have a waterproof phone case or a GoPro.

Bring fresh clothes for the shower after the hike up and a towel.

Had the best Pho for lunch and got to talk some more with the amazing Jim, Hung and Jude. Thank you!

(They also have a lovely camera and takes great photos)
Great Cycle Tour from Da Lat to Nha Trang. Scenery was so beautiful, it’s a ‘can’t miss’ adventure.

Our guide Jackie were lovely and very knowledgeable about the local culture, and history. Nothing was a hassle for these two and we felt very well catered for, welcomed and had a great time,  despite the rain. The tour has been very well thought out and the food was incredible!

This was our third Canyoning tour we had so far and this was definitely the craziest (in a positive way) and coolest we had 🤩 Bin and D were great were extremely great guides and also just cool guys!
Definitely as for these two gents when you're nearby the Da Lat area and when you are up for an exciting activity :)
We started with a pickup in the morning, then the Canyoning after some practice first. Your stuff will be kept safe while you're on the trip. And last but not least, the guys take pictures, and videos of you, so don't bring your phone!;)
And don't forget to enjoy the view and the rainforest around you!:)

reviews.text: Can’t recommend enough !! Tony and Sam were the best guides ever made everything so fun, which really put the nerves at ease ! The abseiling was amazing and definitely worth the money !! Lunch was feast which catered for veggies also!! Also the legend Sam has a iPhone 14pro + so be assured he will get the best photos and videos for you which they airdrop for free after the tour!! AWSOME

Had the best experience today with Vincent, Seven, Bee, Kay and Justin. They were all so friendly and helpful. The canyoning was so amazing, lunch was great and got free photos too! Would highly recommend to anyone!

This excursion was the highlight of my trip! The guides were polite and knowledgeable. I felt safe and comfortable, even while jumping off a 30 foot cliff! It was a very physical day, but the lunch and water they provided gave me the energy I needed. None of the time felt wasted as we walked through the beautiful jungle to each abseiling opportunity. The difficulty level gradually increased as we progressed, and so did my confidence. I highly recommend to anyone who enjoys nature and an adrenaline rush! The views are spectacular and I left feeling very accomplished.
An experience. You’re getting quite wet during the waterfalls and it takes some courage to do all of them. And a shoutout to the staff, Naly, Fin and Vin. Great food aswell. Big like!!
We had to pleasure to be guided by Tony and Sam. They were very kind and professional. We were with a small group. It was a very fun experience and worth the money. Thank you again Tony and Sam!

reviews.text: We booked here sunrise tour and it was amazing experience! Good guide met us, fed us & made great photos & videos on supboard. Lake is so pure, air is cool & fresh. If you need something relaxing,but with some activities- highly recommend!

Had a great time today at the sunrise SUP tour with Happy and Seven!

They were both very patient and kind, i had no issues and enjoyed thoroughly even though it was my first time paddle boarding :-)

The whole journey was about 2 hours, and you get breakfast after! great for early risers (if youre lucky you might get the river to yourself too with noone else around)!

Views were misty because it rained, but still beautiful. Great experience, definitely recommend!

We had a great time doing the trekking and paddling excursion with Justin today! The tour was a nice mix of activity and leisure, and the picnic style lunch was amazing! A big thanks to Justin and our driver for a grat day :))

Great day with Justin and Happy, hiking in the forest and paddling on the lake !
Good food, got lucky enough to see a snake !

Amazing trip with the our instructors Luc and Hau. Luc helped us prepare for our trip and Q&A very fast. This was my first time doing this but thanks to their support, I was able to try the different forms on the board. Hau helped us get very pretty photos and entertained our numerous questions about Da Lat and Tuyen Lam lake.

The facilities are clean and equipped with hot water and beautiful rustic decorations.

Very prompt and easy booking with Mr Vu as well. Overall, highly recommended.

20 Minutes Drive from Da Lat, Beautiful Scenery with Friendly Dogs and Cats

The camp is about a 20-minute drive from the center of Dalat. The access road is quite easy, there is car parking and clean staff. Friendly and cute staff.
Here is beautiful and fresh like a countryside painting.
I filmed a lot of beautiful 🎞️ and saved it on YouTube and Tiktok channel "Linh solo camping"
I had a wonderful night camping. I will come back 🫶
